She has seven hectares of rice farm, which she has worked for 10 years to provide financial support to overcome her family's hardships. 

This is the first microloan for Nuon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She is in a group of two to seek a new loan of KHR 1,000,000 each. 

As the leader, Nuon will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes to minimize the loss due to pests and gain back a good yield to uplift her lifestyle  progressively.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur   Mamadou  est âgé de 42 ans,  marié  et père de 2 enfants, il  vit dans une famille traditionnelle au quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné  l’école des son jeune âge, il commença à exercer le métier de photographe caméraman auprès d’un parent. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage, il évolua seul pour exercer la même activité il ya 18 ans. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de sa prestation qui est d’une grande dextérité, son sens de créativité et d’imagination fait de lui un grand dans le domaine de la photographie et de la camera. Son renommée dépasse Ségou jusqu’ au fin coin du terroir.  
Dans  le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de faire face à la demande clientèle, il  a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Il  est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 12  mois,  après 1  prêt  individuel  bien remboursé, il   est à son 2ème   prêt individuel qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter 1 camera de marque PANASONIC. Il  s’approvisionne  à Bamako. 
Monsieur   Mamadou  fait ses prestations toujours au comptant à une clientèle mixte. Il  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et de prendre en charge ses activités.
texts.en:
Mamadou is 42 years old and married with two children. He lives in a traditional family in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Having dropped out of school at a young age, he began to work as a photographer with a parent. After several years of training, he grew only to perform the same activity as 18 years ago. His sales are due to the quality of his service, which he is skilled in. His sense of creativity and imagination make him a great in the field of photography. His reputation stretches from Segou until the corner of the land.

In order to increase his capital to meet customer demand, he turned to Soro Yiriwaso. He has been working with them for 12 months, after one fully repaid individual loan. This is his second individual loan, which he intends to use to buy one Panasonic camera. He will purchase it at Bamako.

Mamadou provides his services to a mixed clientele. He expects to earn a monthly income of 80,000 F CFA, which he will use to repay the loan and to support his activities.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To support her daughter’s education cost for a university degree

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis es un hombre dedicado a la venta de electrodomésticos que comercializa en diferentes pueblos de la región donde vive con su madre y su hija; su jornada laboral comienza desde muy temprano en las mañanas cuando sale hacia los diferentes pueblos donde tiene su clientela. El cliente es un señor pujante, activo, trabajador y dedicado a su familia y a su labor, por esto se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito que desea invertir en la compra de electrodomésticos al por mayor (ventiladores, planchas, sanducheras, entre otros) con esto podrá aumentar su inventario para ofrecer más variedad y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, así aumentará sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas, con los que continuará velando por el bienestar de su familia. Luis desea generar más recursos que le permitan tener una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar a su hija y a su madre mejores condiciones y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is a man dedicated to selling domestic electric appliances in different towns in the region where his mother and daughter live. His workday begins very early in the morning when he leaves to the different towns where he has his customers. He is a man who is thriving, active, hard-working and dedicated to his family and his work. Therefore he is motivated to seek loan support as he wishes to invest in buying domestic electric appliances at wholesale (fans, irons, sandwich grills, and others) and with this he will be able to increase his inventory in order to offer more variety and meet his customers' needs, thereby he will increase his sales and from the income he receives from the sales he will continue taking care of his family's well-being. Luis wishes to generate more income that will enable him to have a favorable economic stability in order to provide his daughter and mother better living conditions and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy domestic electric appliances at wholesale (fans, irons, sandwich grills, etc.)

loans.name: Rethy

texts.en:
Rethy is a young married man residing in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. He strives for a living via cassava and rice farming.  It is a business that he has had for four years, earning almost US$ 7 per day. 

This is the first microloan for Rethy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is seeking this first loan in order to pay tuition for his older brother, who wants to pursue his vocational training in electricity. He hopes this financial support will allow his older brother to have a specialized skill to make a living.

loans.use: To pay tuition for his brother

loans.name: Sorphorn

texts.en:
Sorphorn is 33 years old and a married mother blessed with two children who are in school. To tackle the family financial burden, she does rice farming on a one-and-a-half-hectare area and cassava planting on a three-hectare area.This is the business that she has had for four years. 

With this new loan, Sorphorn is in her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to upgrade her living conditions better than before. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her crop. 

She hopes to gain a good yield and triple her income, so she can buy rubber tree seedlings for growing to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: And Siggil Hann 14 Group

texts.fr: L’Association And Siggil Hann regroupe plusieurs femmes ressortissant de l’une des banlieues  Dakaroises. Au départ elles se fréquentaient   a travers des  tontines  hebdomadaires  qui leur permettaient de s’autofinancer pour soutenir leurs activités génératrices de revenus .Actuellement l’association vient de signer un partenariat avec l’UIMCEC dans le cadre du renforcement du pouvoir économique des femmes  pour les aider  a mieux gérer leurs activités et lutter contre la pauvreté. De ce fait And Siggil Hann 14  regroupe 12 femmes  qui habitent la  même localité  et évoluent  dans le même secteur d’activité. Elles  exercent  des activités commerciales et sont représentées par madame Ndeye. C’est une femme mariée qui  pratique la vente de poissons et en même temps s’adonne au micro jardinage depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit prévu pour l’achat de  poissons a revendre. Elle ambitionne de développer son activité de commerce pour accroitre ses bénéfices et parvenir a supporter la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et mieux entretenir ses enfants. Son projet  futur consiste a acquérir un camion frigorifique.
texts.en:
The Association And Siggil Hann includes several women residing in one of the Dakar suburbs. Initially they attended weekly tontines [savings groups] that allowed them to be self-sufficient and support their income generating activities. Currently the association has signed a partnership with UIMCEC for the economic empowerment of women to better help them manage their operations and fight against poverty. 

Thus Siggil Hann 14 includes 12 women who live in the same region and work in the same industry. They engage in commercial activities and are represented by Ndeye. She is a married woman who sells fish and at the same time has done microgardening for over 20 years. She is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC and is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. She aims to expand her business activity to increase her income, pay for the daily expenses of her family, and better support her children. Her next project is to acquire a refrigerated truck.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en: Heang is 53 years old and has six children. She is a villager from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she plants rice and cassava on two hectares each. This business has returned her about 38,000 KHR per day. Heang is a second-time borrower and her joint borrower is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Heang’s past loan has enabled her to improve her business on time and she repaid that loan with success. For this cycle, she is asking for 1,200,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for both her cash-crops. She expects to gain a good yield from her crops and make double income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for both her cash-crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Age 40 and a villager from Kampong Cham province, Sophy is a married mother of three dependent children. Her family's core income comes from two hectares of rice farming, and also from working for others for a fee. This business earns her about 23,600 KHR per day. This is the second microloan for Sophy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The first loan enabled Sophy to lease an additional plot of farmland to expand her agribusiness.  She repaid that loan on time with success. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing and transplanting fees for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield from her business so that she can make more income to sustain her living and her keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and to pay plowing and transplanting fees for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Ath

texts.en: Ath, 56, is a citizen from Kandal province. She is married and has nine children, six of whom are in school. She takes care of her family especially in covering the daily basic needs and her children's education costs via selling mosquito net, fabric, and silk. Besides this business, her family can also get income from rice farming and cow raising as well. Ath is a fourth-cycled client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely to improve her living. For this cycle, she is seeking a new loan in order to pay tuition fees for her son who is pursuing a bachelor degree majoring in Information Technology. She hopes her son will get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay for college tuition for her son

loans.name: Villa

texts.en: Villa is 41 years old and a married mother of three schoolchildren. She is a rice farmer on four hectares of farmland while her husband is a paid worker. She has been involved in this business for three years. Villa has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is seeking a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and herbicide for her paddy rice. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop and make more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicide for her paddy rice

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots and cucumbers.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 34 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la productos nutricionales y medicinales nutricionales, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar hierbas y alcohol, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sabina is 34 years old and lives in the community of Sunchubamba, in the Province of Paucartambo. She is an enterprising and hard-working person who gets her family ahead by her effort and work. Her business is nutritional products and nutritional medicines. She is a responsible person and for this reason she was invited to join the “Tres Cruces de Oro” communal bank. 

At this time she is requesting a loan to buy herbs and alcohol. She is grateful for and values the loan and promises to honor the monthly installments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy herbs and alcohol.

loans.name: Thida's Group

texts.en: Thida is a 29-year-old mother of one little kid. Residing in Battambang province, she is a cassava farmer whereas her husband works for others for a fee besides helping her on the farmland. The two years' experience in her current business have enabled her to earn about 25,000 KHR per day. It is not her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely used her prior loans with success to support her business promptly and get a decent income to provide meals three times per day for her family. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain good yield from her crop so she can make more income to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sivan

texts.en: A breadwinner in the family consisting of three children living in Kampong Cham province, Sivan is a farmer who grows rice, cassava, and rubber tree seedlings. She has engaged in her current business for 18 years and now it has returned her around 40,000 KHR per day. Sivan, who is in her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has repaid her past loan wisely to improve her lifestyle. Now, she is asking for 4,000,000 KHR in order to sow more rubber tree seedlings and to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield from her various crops and make more income.

loans.use: To sow more rubber tree seedlings and to buy fertilizer for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 33 years old and lives with her husband and children in Margibi County, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. Her children  are between 3 and 16 years old and all are in school. For six years now she has been involved with business in the market. Her aunt taught her how to do business and by this means she was able to make her own business. Two years ago she started selling used clothes. She makes more profit and she is popular. She is asking for a loan to buy more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Hapet

texts.en:
Hapet is 36 years old and his lives with his family in Stepanavan city in Lori region. He has two school-aged children. His wife does not work. Hapet works at the Stepanavan Gasification local area as a sentry-controller operator. The flat where Hapet lives with his family is very old and needs to be repaired, but Hapet with his salary manages only to provide his family with food and pay for utility fees. 
Hapet asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to do some cosmetic repairs of the walls and ceilings of his flat. He wishes greatly to provide to his wife and children with good and nice living conditions.

loans.use: to do some cosmetic repairs of the walls and ceilings of his flat

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
María Eva es una mujer joven de 28 años con un grado de educación primaria completa, madre soltera de un hijo la cual se dedica a la venta y siembra de hortalizas (papa). Ella vive con sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que no pudieron apoyar en sus estudios le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. Ella también en ocasiones cultiva granos básicos como maíz y frijol pero para consumo y en ocasiones lo vende con los amigos y vecinos de la zona. La tierra que trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia que le dio sus padres la cual está ubicada muy cerca de su casa a la cual se traslada a pie para dar asistencia a sus cultivos de maíz, frijoles y papa. 

Sus planes y sueños a futuro son los de poder construir su propia casa de habitación como también poder emprender nuevos cultivos en su tierra para fortalecer su negocio y dar a su hijo la educación que ella no pudo tener por la falta de apoyo económico. Ella está solicitando a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, herbicidas, fungicidas y semilla de papa certificada para poder cultivar y dar asistencia y mantenimiento.
texts.en:
María Eva is a young 28-year-old woman who completed primary school. She is a single mother with one child and she makes her living planting and selling vegetables (potatoes). She lives with her parents who taught her to work the land at a very young age. They were not able to support her in her education so that taught her to work the land. On occasion she also plants staples like corn and beans but she only grows those for personal consumption and occasionally she sells them to her friends and neighbors in the area. The land she works is her own thanks to an inheritance her parents gave her. It is located very close to her house and she walks there to maintain her corn, bean, and potato crops. 

Her plans and dreams for the future are to be able to build her own house in addition to cultivating new crops on her land so as to strengthen her business and give her child the education she did not have due lack of financial support. She is requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy agricultural supplies like manure, plant fertilizers, herbicides, fungicides, and certified potato seeds to be able to plant and maintain them.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds to plant and agricultural supplies to maintain the crop.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: A villager from Kandal province, Phen is 34 years old and has two children. Her entire family counts on a single business, rice farming. It is the business that she has had for 10 years and it has returned her about 17,600 KHR per day. Phen is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is requesting her first loan in order to buy rice seed, to plow her farmland, and to pay for transplanting fee. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crop and double her income.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, to plow her farmland, and to pay for transplanting fee

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en: An elderly mother of nine children living in Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sitha is a local farmer who grows mango. Her husband also help her to earn extra income via working as a paid worker by spraying insecticide on others' mango plantations and vegetable gardens. This is the business that she has had for ages and it has returned her about 20,000 KHR per day. Sitha is a first-cycled client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now leading a group of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her mango plantation. She hopes to gain a good yield and triple her income to improve her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her mango plantation

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza is married with six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed, chicks, and chicken vaccines. She works from home six days out of every week and sells to all categories of people on retail and wholesale basis. She generates additional income from rental rooms. Her major business challenge includes thieves and seasonality. She aspires to own a big poultry farm and also to build more rental rooms. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying for utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed, chicken vaccines and chicks

loans.name: Salat's Group

texts.en:
Salat, the breadwinner for her family of three children, is 59 years old.  She is a widow and raises her children as a single mother by growing beans and eggplant. She has been involved in this business for ages and it has returned to her about 9,400 KHR (Cambodian Riel) per day. 
Salat has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles of loans and she has fully repaid her past loans with success. The past loan has enabled her to upgrade her living to being better than before. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and seed for replanting. She hopes that she can harvest a good yield and upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash and seed for replanting

loans.name: Dúo Latino Group

texts.es: Dúo Latino, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Marta de 54 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace muchos años, ya que el negocio es un medio que ella tiene para salir adelante con su familia, es por eso que en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz por mayo ya que solo asi el precio del maiz es mas varato, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar ya que este es una buena oportunidad para aumentar y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en: Marta, 54, is a member of the communal bank "Duo Latino."   She's had a business making and selling tortillas for many years, because this business is a means through which she can get ahead with her family.  For this reason, she is now requesting this loan to buy corn at wholesale, because this way the price of corn will be much cheaper.  She is hoping that you can help her, because this is a good opportunity for her to increase and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Fatu. She is married and has five children ages 37, 31, 29, 28 and 23 years old. In 1989, Fatu established her textiles business. She began her business to enable her to take care of her family. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL.

Fatu requires a loan in order to buy additional textiles for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 600,000 SLL. Two of her children are now in the university. She is honest and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional textiles for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Houy's Group

texts.en: Houy is 44 years old and a mother of four children. She resides in Sa Ang district of Kandal province. Her main source of family income is from sugarcane farming business. This business, which she has engaged in for 20 years, has returned her about 36,000 KHR per day. This not the original loan for Houy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan has enabled her to support her family on time and afford to save up her money to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. Now, in a group of five, she is a leader. She and her co-borrowers are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy sugarcane seedlings, to pay for plowing fee, and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can replant her crop on time and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy sugarcane seedlings and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Sreysor's Group

texts.en: Sreysor, a villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, is 30 year old and married. She has two children in school to cater for. Her family’s main source of income is from fish catching for resale, which she has been involved with for seven years and it has returned her about 23,000 KHR per day. This is the fifth loan for Sreysor. She has fully repaid back her past loan wisely to upgrade her lifestyle and she can manage to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a boat and fishing net to support her business. She hopes that she can catch more fish for sale and make more income.

loans.use: To buy a boat and fishing net to support her business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana tiene 45 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de leche, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para las vacas lecheras como por ejemplo pastos y concentrados, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Juliana is 45 years old and lives in Sunchubamba in the Province of Paucartambo. She is a hard-working and enterprising person who is improving her family's situation with her hard work selling milk. Because she is a very responsible person, she was invited to participate in the communal bank called "Tres Cruces de Oro" (Three Gold Crosses).  She is seeking a loan to buy food such as fodder and concentrated feed for her dairy cows.

She is most appreciative and grateful for the loan and promises to be  responsible about meeting her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy food such as fodder and concentrated feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Savang's Group

texts.en: Savang is 45 years old and the mother of six children, residing in Bakan district of Battambang province. To cover the daily cost of living, she does rice cropping and her husband catches fish to sell and builds houses for a fee. She has been involved in the current business for 29 years, earning about 18,200 KHR per day. Savang is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In this cycle, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a fishing net and boat for her husband to catch more fish. She hopes to gain a good income from her business and keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy a fishing net and boat for her husband to catch more fish

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 30-year-old married mother of four children. She lives and work in a Palestinian camp to support her family and help her husband in covering their family's increasing needs.

Six years ago she started selling clothes and candies from her house. Today she's still working from her house because she can't afford the expenses of opening a separate shop.

Fatima is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her clothes capital with new autumn and winter collection and to start selling household appliances and accessories.

She is very excited for this loan which will diversify her products and increase her income and develop her business. She hopes that one day she'll be financially capable of supporting her family more and move to a separate multipurpose selling shop outside the camp.

loans.use: To increase her clothes business with new autumn and winter collection and to start selling household appliances and accessories

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy, age 61, is married and blessed with five children. To deal with her primary basic need, she grows rice and plant mango. This is the business that she has had for ages. This business has returned her about 6 USD per day. Thy is a second–cycled client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan that she has repaid with success, has enabled her to relieve her family burden better than before. For this new cycle, she is asking for a new loan in order to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop. She expects to gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilzer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Yeng is 32 years old and married. She is blessed with three children, two schoolchildren and one little kid. She strives for a living via rice farming and fish catching, in which she has engaged for 12 years and it has returned her about 41,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Yeng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely to improve her living condition. Now she is asking for a new loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, insecticide, and to pay for plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield from her agribusiness and double her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, insecticide, and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Sebastian Adalberto

texts.es: Sebastián Adalberto de cincuenta y dos años de edad es un hombre soltero, el es jornalero y trabaja en una finca, es muy entregado a su labor, muy responsable y sobre todo humilde, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural. Actualmente él posee un pequeño lavadero que está en muy mal estado por lo que desea construir un lavadero con su pila más grande, que pueda recolectar más agua. ya que Sebastián Adalberto no tiene todo el capital que lo respalde, se decidió solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar los materiales, cemento, arena, ladrillo de barro y pagar la mano de obra. Sebastián Adalberto está muy contento y agradecido con la ayuda y asegura que podrá saldar toda la deuda.
texts.en:
Sebastián Adalberto is a 52-year-old man who is single.  He is a day laborer and works on a farm.  Sebastián is very responsible and dedicated to his work, but above all, he is humble.  His home is located in a rural area.  He currently has a small washroom that is in very bad condition.  For this reason, he wants to build a washroom with a larger trough that can hold more water.  However, Sebastián Adalberto does not have all of the necessary capital, so he decided to request a loan from FUSAI in order to buy materials, cement, sand, clay bricks, as well as pay for labor.  

Sebastián Adalberto is very pleased and appreciates the help he has received.  He assures everyone that the entire debt will be repaid.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a washroom.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his wife (in the photo) and his daughter (in the photo). Davit has been driving a taxi for 10 years. Over these years of hard work, Davit was able to gather income that allows him to cover his family's basic needs. 

A month ago, Davit sold his car to purchase a new minibus which will allow him to transport more people. Unfortunately, due to family's bad living conditions, Davit spent some of that money, and now needs USD 1,475 to purchase the minibus. 

This is the reason why Davit has applied for this loan. He has been approved for the loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The Start-Up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions for informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan is very important for Davit to be able to purchase a minibus and continue his taxi driving business.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to be able to continue his taxi driving business.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en: Aasia, age 35, is an energetic married woman with five children. She has been actively involved in the business of selling flowers for a period of one year. She purchases stock of different flowers and after making garlands she sells them in her community. She also gets orders for events like weddings and birthdays and earns a good amount of income to bear her household expenses. Currently she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy stock of different flowers such as red roses, jasmine, and lilies with some reels of white thread. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and will generate more revenue. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of different flowers such as red roses, jasmine, and lilies with some reels of white thread.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en: Kim is a mother of two children in school. Her main sources of income are selling groceries and growing rice. She has been doing this business to support her family for eight years. Including this loan, she is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she teams up a group of two to get a new loan.  As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items in order to replenish her grocery business. She hopes to support her grocery items in a timely manner and expand her business larger than before to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items in order to replenish her grocery business

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUTIMUY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Belen ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de librería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de golosinas.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the community bank "Kutimuy", located in the district of Cusco, in the province and state of the same name. 

Maria Belen, 42, is single and has 2 children. She works in her grocery store, selling basic goods like rice, sugar, milk and oil. She has a stall in the market where she sells her groceries from 8am to 6pm. She has been in this business for one year and it's going very well. Her dream is to increase her business. She asks for a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

She thanks those who are part of her dream in this way, and promises to make her payments on the established schedule. 

The other members of the group have businesses including clothing sales, a bookstore, grocery store, and selling snacks.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Celia Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de verduras, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo papas, lechuga, zanahorias, tomates y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Virginia is 28 years old and lives in the community of Sunchubamba, which is in Paucartambo Province.  She is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants to move her family forward.  Through her work efforts, she manages a business of selling vegetables.  Virginia is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Tres Cruces de Oro” (Three Crosses of Gold).  

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as potatoes, lettuce, carrots, tomatoes, and other types of produce.  She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, lettuce, carrots, tomatoes, and other types of produce.

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en:
Yamah is 42 years old, and she lives in Magibi county, which is the largest rubber-producing area in Liberia.  She has three children between 12 and 21 years old.  They attend school and live at home.  She is respected in her family, and she is the mother of a supportive home.  Her husband is a businessman.

For the past seven years, she has been selling rice in the market.   One of the problems she faces is that she doesn't have a good location for her selling place. 

Yamah is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for many years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community and the best at making beautiful patterns with threads and beads. She has attained a regular list of customers. 

To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. This way she would be able to cater more customers consistently. 

She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Musrat is a 40-year-old vigorous lady. She initiated a business of tandoor (clay oven used for cooking in North India and Pakistan). She cooks chapattis and naan for the people of her community, and takes orders from nearby hotels. In this way she makes enough money to have a decent life. 

She is a mother of five, and motivated to provide them with a beautiful life and good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is her sixth year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business with the support of it. Now she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil. 

She hopes to increase in the number of customers and desires to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil for her Tandoor business.

loans.name: Raffit

texts.en: Raffit is a 38-years-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past six years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income received to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, Raffit is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue, so she may generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.pt:
Eusebio vive maritalmente tem 51 anos de idade e pai de 3 filhos e seguranca numa empresa privada de onde trabalha em regime de turnos.

Com o valor do emprestimo ira comprar cimento, blocos, ferros, porta para terminar sua obra.
Seu maior sonho e concluir a obra e comprar uma viatura para transporta pessoal e oficializar o casamento.
Gostaria que o apoio financeiro  continuasse para alavancar o nivel de vida das comunidades e propoe se a  pontualmente e  solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar os seus planos futuros.
texts.en:
Eusebio is married. He's 51 years old and has three children. He's a security guard for a private company where he works by shifts.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, bricks, iron and a door so he can finish his construction work.
His biggest dream is to finish the construction work, purchase a vehicle for personal transportation and make his marriage official.
He would like for the financial support to continue in order to improve living conditions within the communities. He pledges to repay the loan in a timely fashion and apply for more loans so he can accomplish his plans for the future.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, iron and a door.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario tiene 41 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la elaboración de casas y obras de construcción, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como martillos, cemento, clavos, yeso, pinturas y otras cosas más, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Mario is 41 years old and lives in the community of Sunchubamba, which is in Paucartambo Province.  He is a hardworking and enterprising person who wants his family to get ahead.  Through his work efforts, he manages a business of building houses and performing other construction jobs.  Mario is a responsible person, which is why he was invited to participate in the Communal Bank “Tres Cruces de Oro” (Three Crosses of Gold). 

He is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy materials for his work such as hammers, cement, nails, plaster, paint, and other supplies.  He appreciates and values this loan, so he promises to complete his monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy hammers, cement, nails, plaster, paint, and other supplies for his construction work.

loans.name: Belinha

texts.pt:
Belinha de 54 anos de idade é solteira tem 6 filhos já maiores de idade a viverem nas sua casas,  ela vive na casa prória tipo 1. É comerciante ha mais de 15 anos e trabalha apartir das 6 horas e não tem hora fixa de saida.
Com o presente emprestimo ira comprar cimento, pedra, areia para ampliar sua casa com mais um quarto e uma sala pois agora vive em uma que e so um quarto.
Seus planos para o futuro  terminar sua obra, mobilar a casa e melhorar seus negocio e construir um estabelecimento de venda de produtos na sua casa para melhorar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Belinha is 54 years old and single. She has six children who are already adults and live in their own homes. She lives in a one-bedroom house that she owns. She has been a vendor for over 15 years. She starts working at 6 a.m. and doesn't have a scheduled time to get off.
With the current loan she'll purchase cement, rocks and sand. That way she'll enlarge her house with one more bedroom and a living room, since right now she lives in a house with only one bedroom.
Her plans for the future are to finish the construction work, furnish her house and improve her business. She also plans to build a store to sell merchandise in her house so that she can increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks and sand.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 49 years old and married, with two children.  Her husband works in a factory, with a low salary income. 

Naseem was wise enough to think about another source of income in their home, so she initiated her business of sewing clothes. She very well knows the techniques of sewing. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy stocks of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers to meet the increasing demand for her work.  

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is in her second loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She has been stitching clothes for many years to support her husband financially. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. Her daughter also assists her in completing the orders for her customers on time. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in Margibi County, which is the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. She is 43 years old and is married. She has six children between 8 and  23 years old, and all of them live at home and attend school. Her husband is a Firestone-tapper. For the past ten years she has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, and other items in the local market. She spends eight hours on her business six day a weeks. Mostly she uses a car to get her goods from the village. She is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, and other items for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been running a business of clothes sales for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Nasreen requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the current season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the current season.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is 38 years old and he lives in Kapan city, Armenia. He lives here with his wife, two children (a son and a daughter) and his retired mother. Armen works as a worker and because of insufficient salary, he continues to look for another job with better terms. To date, he still has not found anything better and he has to work hard to provide for his family's living expenses. After many years of savings, recently Armen has decided to repair his house, but his savings has sufficed only partly for the repairs.  He is asking for a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams in order to buy some cords, switches and other electrical parts for his house.

loans.use: to buy some cords, switches and other electrical parts for his house

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.pt:
O senhor Arnaldo é viúvo e pai de 3 filhos que frequentam o nίvel primário tem 35 anos de idade é comerciante há mais de 10 anos e trabalha durante 10 horas por dia.
Com o valor do emprestimo vai comprar cimento, areia, varões para dar continuidade a sua obra.
No futuro pretende construir casa para os filhos para quando eles crescerem.
Diz que irá pagar pontualmente o empréstimo para voltar a solicitar mais.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is a widower and has three children who attend elementary school. He's 35 years old and has been a vendor for over 10 years. He works 10 hours a day.
With the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, sand and rods in order to continue the construction work.
In the future he intends to build a house for his children for when they're grown up.
He states that he'll repay the loan in a timely fashion so he can request more loans again.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and rods in order to continue the construction work.

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam is a 22-year-old lady and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for five years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

When Neelam was not earning, her family was going through sever financial crisis. That compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her father and brother are working in a factory, due to limited resources; they couldn't be fulfilling their household expenditures. 

Neelam felt an obligation to change her family’s living standards, and started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele, but she was having difficulty fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf. 

Neelam has requested PKR 10,000 and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in different colors. She expects a boost in her earnings, and wishes to spend the part of her income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and some spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
A senhora Aida é professora há 6 anos trabalha das 12 as 17.30, ela é viuva tem 4 filhos que estudam e tem 42 anos de idade.
Com o valor do emprestimo vai comprar cimento, varroes, barrotes, estribos, e chapas de zinco para dar continuidade a sua obra de ampliacao de sua casa com mais um quarto, cozinha e casa de banho interna.
Seus planos sao voltar a estudar, dar maior acompanhamento aos estudos dos seus filhos e terminar a sua obra um projecto que comecou com o seu falecido esposo.
Diz que ira pagar pontualmente o emprestimo e voltar a solicitar mais para realizar os seus planos melhorando o conforto de sua casa.
texts.en:
Aida has been a teacher for six years and works from noon to 5:30 p.m. She's a widow and has four children who study. She's 42 years old.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, rods, beams, brackets and metal sheets so she can continue her construction work. She's enlarging her house with one more bedroom, a kitchen and an indoor bathroom.
Her plans are to go back to school, overlook her children's studies more closely and finish the construction work, a project that she started alongside her late husband.
She states that she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion and request more loans again so she can achieve her plans by making her house more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, beams, brackets and metal sheets.

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
A senhora Margarida é casada e tem 4 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam o nίvel primário e. Vive na casa própria com os filhos e esposo que trabalha nas bombas de combustivel, ela é comerciante .
Com o valor do crédito vai comprar cimento, areia, porta, varrões, pedra para a construção de uma dependência para os filhos.
No futuro pretende oficializar o seu casamento e terminar a obra.
Diz que ira pagar o emprestimo e solicitar mais para concretizar seus planos e garantir escolaridade para seus filhos
texts.en:
Margarida is married and has four children, three of whom attend elementary school. She lives with her children and her husband in a house that she owns. Her husband works on fuel pumps and she's a vendor.
With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement, sand, rods, rocks and a door so she can build a room for her children.
In the future she intends to make her marriage official and finish the construction work.
She states that she'll repay the loan and request more loans so she can accomplish her plans and guarantee an education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rods, rocks and a door.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his business tools

loans.name: Norin

texts.en: Norin is a 36-year-old married woman. Three years ago she started her general store business to support her family. She offers various goods for daily use.  She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Norin is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. As Norin wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy stocks of flour, sugar and biscuits from the wholesale market. She then would be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She is in her 7th loan cycle with a good repayment history. Norin wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of flour, sugar and biscuits

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a 46-years -old married lady and enjoys doing hand embroidery. She has been doing this work for the past eight years. Rubina makes beautiful embroidery patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute towards the expenses of her home. To help her continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. Rubina dreams of providing for her children's bright future and well-being.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
O senhor João é professor, tem 29 anos é casado  tem 1 filha que estuda e sustenta um irmão que vive com os outra familia.
Com o valor do crédito pretende  comprar cimento, janelas, areia, e rebocar a sua casa e fazer parte do muro de vedação.
Para o futuro tem como planos terminar sua obra e muro adiquirir uma viatura para uso familiar e oficializar o casamento.
Diz que gosta dos serviços oferecidos pela instituição pois ajuda muita gente e ele próprio tem coisas que só com seu salário não iria conseguir  e que irá pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
João is 29 years old and a teacher. He's married and has a daughter who studies. He supports his brother who lives with another family.
With the amount of the loan he intends to purchase cement, windows and sand, to plaster his house and to build part of the surrounding wall.
His plans for the future are to finish the construction work and the wall, acquire a vehicle for family use and make his marriage official.
He states that he likes the services provided by the institution because they help many people, and there are things that he couldn't afford on his salary alone. He also states that he'll repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase cement, windows and sand, to plaster his house and to build part of the surrounding wall.

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es: El señor Bladimir, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, vive con su concubina en alquiler y todavía no cuentan con hijos, pero ya tienen planeado tener un hijo, no en un futuro lejano, actualmente el señor está trabajando como camarógrafo de prensa se mueve de un lugar a otro en una motocicleta que el canal le ha proporcionado para que pueda cumplir con su trabajo, quien trabaja de lunes a viernes sin descanso y tambien los fines de semanas se dedica a la venta de Cd´s de todo tipo (de acción, drama, comedias, novelas, terror y otros), para que puedan subsistir él y su pareja, ahora el señor necesita ayuda para que pueda amoblar su cuarto, por esta razón  está solicitando un  préstamo para la compra de un refrigerador y de un ropero para que así tengan donde guardar su ropa y donde puedan guardar las verduras y la carne que ellos se compran para que se puedan alimentar.
texts.en: Bladimir is a hard-working and responsible person. He lives with his partner in a rental. They do not have any children yet, but are planning on it in the near future. He is currently working as a press cameraman and moves from one place to another on his motorcycle provided by the channel so he can do his job. He works tirelessly from Monday through Friday. On the weekends, he sells all kinds of CDs (action, drama, comedies, dramas, horror, and more). This helps him take care of his wife and himself. Now, Bladimir needs help to furnish his room, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and a wardrobe so he can store his clothes and the vegetables and meat they buy for food.

loans.use: to buy a wardrobe and refrigerator for his room

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José es un señor de 57 años de edad, casado y padre de un hijo. Toda su vida ha vivido en el campo donde aprendió las funciones y labores del sector agrario, gracias a ello, hoy en día se dedica a comercializar plátanos que los compra en el pueblo donde reside y los lleva a la ciudad para venderlos, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para el llevar el sustento a su familia. El cliente es un hombre pujante, humilde, activo y muy trabajador, todos los días va en constante búsqueda de opciones que le ayuden a salir adelante, por lo que se anima a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, que desea invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor (plátanos), así podrá aprovechar que el costo del producto se disminuye, mejorando así el nivel de utilidades que recibe por las ventas del producto. De esta manera José podrá seguir realizando su actividad y sueña con poder disfrutar una estabilidad económica que le permita a mediano plazo poder convertirse en un distribuidor más grande para así aumentar la entrada de recursos a la economía familiar y cuando llegue el momento, desea descansar con la tranquilidad de que su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Jose is 57 years old, married and father of a son. He has always lived his life in the field where he learned the roles and responsibilities of the agricultural sector. As a result, today he makes a living selling bananas bought in the town where he lives. Then, he transports the bananas to the city where he sells them. In this way, he generates sufficient resources to support the livelihood of his family.

Jose is a strong man, humble, and very active worker. Everyday he is in the constant search for options to get ahead. For this reason, he asks for a loan, which he plans to invest in the purchase of wholesale bananas to profit from the fact that the cost of the product decreases, thus improving the level of profits from the sales of the product.

In this way José will be able to continue his activity. He dreams of being able to enjoy a economic stability, which allows him in the medium-term to become a bigger distributor and improve his family’s income and when the time comes being able to relax with the peace of mind that his family would have a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy wholesale bananas

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба сотрудничает с нашей организацией в течении 3 лет. Она очень пунктуальный и ответственный клиент. За эти три года не имела ни одной просрочки.  Она продолжает развивать свой бизнес по  откорму скота. Махбуба  является последним ребенком в семье и ее родители не хотят ее отпускать в Россию, они хотят  чтобы она осталась  здесь и продолжила свой бизнес. Конечно же родители ей помогают в ее бизнесе. Отец занимается куплей продажей скота. На данный момент Махбуба нуждается в денежных средствах и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом в Арванд. Махбуба планирует увеличить поголовье скота и стремиться развивать свой бизнес. Этот бизнес является основным доходом в семье. Пока она не вышла замуж так как не было подходящей кондидатуры но рано или поздно Махбуба выйдет замуж и она также копит денежные средства на преданное. Махбуба надеется что с помощью этого кредита она намного расширит свой бизнес и улучшить условия своей семьи.   
На полученный кредит Махбуба купит скот и увеличит свое стадо. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Mahbuba has been working with our organization for three years. She is a very punctual and responsible client. In these three years she hasn't had a single late payment. She continues to develop her business fattening cattle. Mahbuba is the last child in the family and her parents don't want to let her go to Russia; they want her to stay here and continue her business. Of course, her parents help with the business. Her father does the buying and selling of the cattle. At the moment Mahbuba is in financial need and therefore has turned to Arvand for a loan. She plans to increase her number of cattle and further develop her business, which is the primary source of income for her family. So far she has not gotten married since the right candidate hasn't appeared but sooner or later, she will get married and she is saving money for that. Mahbuba hopes that with the help of this loan she will broaden her business a great deal and improve her family's living conditions. With the loan she will buy cattle and increase her herd. She thanks Arvand in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ardiane

texts.en:
Ardiane is very thankful to all Kiva lenders. She used the loan to purchase another cow, so that she now has two milk cows, which she uses for her family’s dietary needs and also for selling the milk and milk products in her area. The loan has helped her to increase her income, doubling the amount she can sell from five to ten liters of milk per day. By this means, she was also able to improve her family’s living conditions, for which she appreciates all lenders for such an opportunity. 

Now she is in need for a second loan to buy 30 goats. She always wanted to keep goats and with the help of this loan, she will be able to realize her dream. Still, her goal is to offer a better life to her family and provide a better education for her children. She also hopes in the future to build another stable for goats and expand her farm. She wants to thank all of the lenders for both loans, which have helped her to achieve her dreams. She is aware that without the loans and assistance, she would never have been able to accomplish her goals.

loans.use: To buy 30 goats.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with five children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a food  stall of fruits and vegetables at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis. She has been in business for two years. She works six days a week.   

She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes and pineapples. Her major business challenges include transportation and electricity. She is aspiring of educating her children to university level. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh beans, tomatoes, onions, mangoes and pineapples.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en: Eseza is married with two children, and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, boxes of Vaseline, weaves, braids and a hand dryer. She generates additional income through selling used and new ladies shoes. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include defaulters, the ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda, which affects her customer base, and on and off electricity. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked beauty salon and also to build her business premises. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxe of cream relaxers, boxes of Vaseline, braids and a hand dryer.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush and her big family live in Kapan city. Anush has graduated Kapan Medical College, where she has received a specialty of nurse, but she has never worked. She has two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is already a student, and her sons are still school-aged. 

In 2005, Anush and her husband opened their own business. They began their clothes and food trading business. She sells in their shop men's, women's and children's clothes and toys. Anush also sells a great range of sweets, dairy products, bread, alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks, etc. All the needed products she brings from Yerevan in a rented car.

Anush asks a loan of $3,000 dollars in order to buy seasonal clothes for adults and clothes for pupils.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes for adults and clothes for pupils.

loans.name: Biziyuda

texts.ru:
Бизиёда женщина в возрасте 62 лет.  К большому сожалению  несколько месяцев назад ее муж умер.  Он был ей опорой и поддержкой. У нее  3 детей, двое дочерей и сын.  Дочери уже замужем, сына еще не женила. 
 Бизиёда работает медсестрой в больнице. В этом году она хотела  сделать дома ремонт и женить сына, но часть денег ушло на похороны  мужа.  Сын Бизиёды работает в одной из частных фирм, он также вносит непосильный вклад в семейный бюджет. Пока еще не похолодало она хочет провести ремонт  дома, а потом уже женить сына , для этого она хочет получить кредит в Арванде чтобы закупить строительные материалы.  Бизиёда и ее сын очень надеятся на поддержку от Арванд.
texts.en:
Biziyuda is a 62-year-old woman.  Much to her sorrow, her husband passed away a few months ago; he was always a source of strength and support for her.  She has 3 children — 2 daughters and a son.  Her daughters are already married, while her son has yet to marry.  Biziyuda works as a nurse in a hospital.  Her son works in a private company, and also makes a significant contribution to the family budget.  

This year, Biziyuda wanted to renovate her home and see her son married, but she had to pay for her husband's funeral expenses.  She would like to have her home renovated before it gets cold, and have her son married thereafter.   Biziyuda and her son are counting on the support of Arvand; she hopes to receive a loan to buy construction materials to use for the renovation.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate her home

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr lives in the village of Kavart, which is in the Syunik region of Armenia. He studied at the Kapan Mountain-Metallurgical College, but since he got married very early he became engaged in farming and agriculture. Norayr has five children; three sons and two daughters. His elder son specializes as a of geologist and one of his daughters is a midwife. His other children are still school-aged. His wife does not work and she helps her husband in their farming activities. 

On their farm they breed two cows, two piglets, ten chickens and thirty-six beehives. They cultivate some vegetables for their own use. Norayr is also very well known in his village, because of his pure and tasty honey that he sells. 

Norayr has some plans of enlarging his cattle farm and he asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy three calves, animal fodder and some hay.

loans.use: to buy three calves, animal fodder and some hay in order to enlarge his farm

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is a 40-year-old married woman with 2 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a retail shop for second hand clothing but also practices farming in order to earn additional income. 

Despite having hardships such as a lot of competition and bad weather, her vision is to own a boutique.

Jesca intends to use the loan to buy second hand clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and margarine to make different pastry products

loans.name: Sirasi

texts.en: Sirasi is a thirty eight year old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. For twenty years he has been operating a retail shop but also practices farming to earn additional income. He began this business in order to support his family. Being the good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to University level and expand his business to new areas. Sirasi intends to use the loan to buy plastic items and glasses to sell.

loans.use: to buy plastic items and glasses to sell.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: You are welcome to meet 21-year-old Siah from Liberia, who resides in the community surrounding the Airport of Liberia in Margibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. Her two children live at home. Her children are between the ages of 1 and 2.  For seven years now she has been involved with a video club business. Her mother assisted her with the money which enabled her to establish this business. She makes more profit and has more customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more African movies CDs, gas for her generator, etc. for her business. Her plan is to open another video club in the next community.

loans.use: to buy more African movies CDs, gas for her generator, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 33 years old. She is a young and successful businesswoman who lives in Gavar City in the Gegharkunik region. Anush graduated from Gavar Musical College and currently works there as a teacher. Anush is not married and she lives with her parents. In addition to her teaching job she also runs her own clothing business. From a rented stall she sells men's and women's clothes which she brings from Yerevan City wholesale markets. Anush's mother helps a lot in this additional clothing business.
Anush requests a loan of 900.000 Armenian drams to buy autumn-winter clothes. Anush has already paid back two loans to Nor Horizon without any delays.

loans.use: to buy a lot of autumn-winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is a farmer from the village of Ayntap in the Ararat region. His family consists of his wife and three school aged children (a son and two daughters). Armen is currently engaged in livestock farming which is the main source of his families income. Armen also cultivates some vegetables, which are sold in the local market. The family’s needs are growing day by day and he needs to work harder to earn a living. Armen currently is eager to enlarge the number of livestock he has. To be able to do so, he requests USD $3,000, which will assist him greatly to purchase cows and to buy some forage for his pigs. Armen has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to their hard work in recent times, Armen was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Armen and his family is thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cows and to buy some forage for his pigs and piglets

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi is a hard working agronomist from the village Vosketap in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and two small children (son – 6 years old, daughter – 2 years old). The family earns a living through the cultivation of tomato, cucumber and some fruits (peach, apricot, cherry, apple, grapes). This is the only source of the family's income. Armenuhi's husband helps her a lot in selling the agricultural products at the local market. To be able to continue the business, Armenuhi needs to make some investment. She needs a loan of USD $3,000 to buy some fertilizer, to purchase fuel for her agricultural machinery, to pay water bills and to pay laborers their harvest wages. She and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and are very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for her agricultural machinery, to pay water bills and to pay labourers their harvest wages

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en: Jennet lives in Margibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia, she is 40 years old, she is unmarried and has two children aged 9 and 23, they both live at home and attend school. For the past ten years she has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, etc in the local market. She spends eight hours a day, six days in a week, and usually uses a taxi to transport her goods to her stall. She requests a loan to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business, and her plans for the future are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, pepper, etc for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials such as cement, sand, metal sheeting and wood planks.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel tiene 19 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es el mantenimiento de artefactos eléctricos como radios, televisores  y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como transistores, resistencias, chips, cables, estaño y otras cosas más, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Abel, 19, lives in the community of Sunchubamba in the province of Paucartambo.  He is a hard-working entrepreneur who supports his family through his business.  He provides maintenance services for electrical items such as radions, television sets and other goods.  He was invited to joing the communal bank "Tres Cruces de Oro" (Three Gold Crosses) because of how responsible he is.

The loan requested by Abel is to buy work materials such as transistors, resistances, chips, cables, pewter and other items.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy work materials such as transistors, resistances, chips, cables, pewter and other items.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja tiene 35 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de verduras y frutas, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo papayas, piñas, plátanos, papas, lechuga, zanahorias, tomates y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maruja, 35, lives in the community of Sunchubamba in the province of Paucartambo.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur who supports her family through her business selling fruits and vegetables.  She was invited to join the communal bank "Tres Cruces de Oro" (Three Gold Crosses) because of how responsible she is.  The loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise such as papayas, pineapples, bananas, potatoes, lettuce, carrots, tomatoes and other goods.  

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as papayas, pineapples, bananas, potatoes, lettuce, carrots, tomatoes and other goods.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Don Luis tiene 47 años de edad, es originario de la ciudad de Granada, casado, padre de 1 hijo. Se dedica a brindar el servicio de reparación, venta de llantas y accesorios para auto móviles desde hace 11 años. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien trabaja en una zona franca. Solicita el crédito para comprar: llantas, rines, parches calientes y fríos entre otros. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda, ya que podrá invertir en materia prima  la cual necesita para realizar su trabajo y satisfacer  las necesidades de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es comprar un local para su negocio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis, 47, is married and has a son.  He lives in the city of Granada, and for 11 years has been in business offering auto repair services, tires and other accessories.  His wife, who works in the duty free zone, supports him.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy tires, rings, hot and cold patches, etc.  He believes the loan will be of much help as he will be able to buy the raw materials he needs to do his work and satisfy customer needs.  In the future he wants to buy a shop for the business where he can offer customers quality services and products.

loans.use: To buy tires, rings, hot and cold patches, etc.

loans.name: Benedicta
