texts.es: Benedicta tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es el cultivo de trigo y cebada, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Benedicta, 36, lives in the community of Sunchubamba in the province of Paucartambo.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur who supports her family through her business growing wheat and barley.  She was invited to join the communal bank "Tres Cruces de Oro" (Three Gold Crosses) because of how responsible she is.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is 22 years old and supports seven children at his farm in Chisamba District, Zambia. Kelvin is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a water pump to irrigate and expand his farm.

Though he is young, Kelvin has been active in growing vegetables and raising chickens, and has recently opened a small shop in his community. Farming however, remains at the core of his business. He has plans to expand both his poultry farm and his vegetable crops, however he currently lacks the water pump needed to cultivate a larger area.

Water pumps can be a major boost for farmers such as Kelvin. A water pump allows farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Kelvin will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Kelvin hopes that with a water pump he will be able to earn more money from selling tomatoes and watermelons, supporting the expansion of his poultry business. He hopes that through his many business activities he will be able to take all his children to school. It is for this reason Kelvin is asking Kiva lenders to support his goal of securing a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and is a nurse and farmer within Chibombo District, Zambia. She is asking Kiva lenders to assist her in securing a loan so that she can expand her farm.

Using buckets to water her crops, Helen has been maintaining a small farm in her spare time, selling cabbage and tomatoes to local markets. However the labour required to maintain her crops is intensive and Helen often struggles to properly water her crops after a long day of work. Helen hopes that a water pump will be the key to her success.

Water pumps can be a major boost for many farmers such as Helen. They allow for farmers to continue growing high value vegetable crops, using less labour than manual watering, and freeing their time for other activities. Unfortunately the upfront costs of such a water pump can be prohibitive. Once she secures a Kiva loan, Helen will get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the pump to her farm and provide training on how to properly maintain and use the equipment.

Helen plans to use the water pump to begin growing new crops, including butternut squash, and okra. She plans to use the extra income to support her children in school and even expand into poultry rearing. It is for this reason Helen is asking for a Kiva loan so that she can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
Doña María Santos tiene 38 años de edad ella es agricultora por tradición ya que en su familia por generaciones se ha trabajado la tierra siendo este rubro el factor económico de su familia. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el tercer grado, es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales el mayor ya es casado en hogar a parte y los demás están viviendo con ella y estudian. La siembra y cultivo de papa es el rubro que ella y su familia trabaja la cual al final de la cosecha es vendida a los intermediarios y vecinos de la zona donde ella habita, estos a su vez la re venden en el mercado local o a nivel nacional. También en ocasiones cuando el precio de la papa es bueno deja ganancias para distribuirla en la siembra de granos básicos como el maíz y frijol. Sus cultivos están ubicados aproximadamente a una hora y media de camino de su casa de habitación siendo este uno de sus desafíos por lo que la asistencia no puede ser a diario.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder mejorar su casa de habitación ya que es necesario como el piso, el techo, repello entre otros que evitaran la acumulación de humedad por estar al descubierto. También seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que ellos puedan graduarse y superarse por medio de sus estudios. Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara semilla certificada de papa para poder cultivar e insumos agrícolas con los cuales dará el mantenimiento necesario posible para obtener una excelente cosecha.
texts.en:
Maria Santos is 28 years old. She is a farmer by tradition, since her family has worked the land for generations for their living. She has been educated to third grade level. She is the mother of five children, the eldest of which is married and living away from home. The others are living with her and studying. Planting and growing potatoes is what her family does. At the end of the harvest, the produce is sold to intermediaries and neighbours, and then resold in the local market or throughout the country. Also sometimes when the price of potatoes is good she puts some of the profits into planting staple grains, such as corn and beans. Her crops are located approximately an hour and a half’s walk away from her house. This distance is one of the challenges she faces, and it means she cannot be there every day.

Her future plans are to improve her house as necessary, such as the floor, the roof, and plastering, in order to avoid the accumulation of humidity due to being uncovered. She also wants to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they can graduate and get ahead through their studies. She has requested a loan, with which she will buy certified potato seed and farming supplies to do the necessary maintenance to obtain an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and certified seed for the planting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to perform maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 63 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Sunchubamba en la provincia de Paucartambo, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica la agricultura donde cultiva trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas y otras cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Saturnina, 63, lives in the village of Sunchubamba in the province of Paucartambo. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who provides for her family with her hard work. 

Her business activity is agriculture. She cultivates wheat, barley, potatoes, root vegetables, vegetables, and other crops. She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to participate in the "Tres Cruces de Oro" communal bank. 

On this occasion, she needs this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She appreciates and values this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment of her monthly installments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her qualification and postgraduate degree.

loans.name: Nurizat

texts.ru: Нуризат 25 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Нуризат - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нуризат занимается полеводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нуризат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1,50 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает: перец, помидоры и фасоль. Каждый год получает хороший и богатый урожай. Реализует оптом на местном овощном рынке. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуризат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на сбор урожая, намерена нанять рабочую силу, должна оплатить за работу им, также сюда включаются затраты на комбайн по сбору урожая. Доходы от кредита Нуризат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nurizat is 25 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Nurizat has a university education. As the main source of income for her family, Nuriza practices crop farming. She started this business 8 years ago, with a start-up investment of 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nuriza's hard work, on her farm she currently has a 1.5 hectare plot of land, on which she grows peppers, tomatoes and beans. Every year, she receives a rich and bountiful harvest. She then sells her produce in bulk at the local vegetable market. Her monthly earnings are 15,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her farming business, Nurizat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) to use for harvesting. Her intent is to hire workers, and she should not only pay for those who work for her, but also for a combine harvester to harvest the crops. Nurizat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into acquiring livestock in the future.

loans.use: to hire workers and a combine to help her harvest her crops.

loans.name: Uuljan

texts.ru: Уулжан 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 дочь. У Уулжан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Уулжан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Уулжан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 40 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,0 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: фасоль. Ежемесячный доход Уулжан составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уулжан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) с целью использовать кредит на сбор урожая. Уулжан хочет оплатить услуги наемным рабочим за сбор урожая фасоли. Доходы от кредита Уулжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Uuljan is 39 years old, married and raising one daughter together with her husband. Uuljan has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Uuljan works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 19 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Uuljan's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow, one calf and 40 sheep. She also has a plot of land of 2.0 hectares where she grows beans every year. Uuljan's monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Uuljan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) with an aim to use the loan for the harvest. Uuljan wants to pay the workers to help harvest the beans. Uuljan plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of household animals, and plans to save money for building a new house.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest beans

loans.name: Nasima

texts.ru: Насиме 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Насимы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Насима занимается животноводством, стартовав 28 лет назад, с покупки скота на 250 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Насимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Насима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Насима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также намерена накопить средства на обучение внуков в институте.
texts.en: Nasima is 55 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Nasima has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Nasima practices livestock breeding. She started this business 28 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 250 som (KGS). Thanks to Nasima's hard work, she currently has six dairy cows on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Nasima turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to to fatten them up for resale on the market at a good price. Nasima plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her grandchildren's university education.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Kulumkan

texts.ru: Кулумкан 31 год, разведена, одна воспитывает сына. У Кулумкан - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулумкан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулумкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 8 овец, а также имеет 3,20 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулумкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на сбор урожая. Кулумкан хочет нанять рабочих для сбора фасоли и оплатить за их услуги. Доходы от кредита Кулумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение сына.
texts.en:
Kulumkan is 31 years old, divorced and raising a son by herself. Kulumkan has specialized secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Kulumkan works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 8 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kulumkan's persistent work, her farm today has two dairy cows, eight sheep and also 3.2 hectares of land. On this she grows beans and perennial grasses. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Kulumkan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Kulumkan wants to hire workers to help her harvest the beans and pay for their services. Kulumkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals, and plans to save money for the continued education of her son.

loans.use: to pay the workers for their help to harvest of beans

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Spartak still continues his business (taking photos, selling sweets and ice cream, popcorn and cheeps), which is located in an amusement park in Kapan city. His two children are still students in paid divisions, and his elder son lives and works in the Russian Federation. 

Spartak’s wife does not work, and Spartak alone works very hard to provide for his family. He has rented his stall for a very long period and he hopes that he will be able to do some innovations in his business.

Spartak has already taken two loans from Kiva and he is also a good client for Nor Horizon. He hopes that this time again Kiva lenders will support him. He asks for a loan of 300,000 AMD to buy some materials for photographing and a new batch of goods for his stall.

loans.use: to buy photography materials and a new batch of goods for his stall.

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is a 43-year-old married man with three children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. For four years, he has been practicing farming. With the proceeds, he has been able to educate his children. Like most farmers, he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations while his dream is to become a model farmer. Zephanus intends to use the loan to buy fertilizers and cotton seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cotton seeds.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is a private entrepreneur from Gyumri, a city in the Shirak region. His family consists of his wife and two school-age children. Harutyun's wife works in the church. To meet the family's daily needs, Harutyun runs a small local store where he sells grocery products, fruits and vegetables as well as household goods. The store is very small, and the income Harutyun gets from the store hardly covers the family’s costs. 

To maintain the small business and to become more competitive in the local market, Harutyun wants to expand the assortment of the products he sells in the store. A loan of $3,000 will be a huge support to the hardworking man and will enable him to buy grocery products, fruits and vegetables as well as household goods to resell in his store. Harutyun and his family will be grateful to all the lenders for helping them acquire the needed loan.

loans.use: to buy new grocery products, fruits and vegetables as well as household goods to resell in his store.

loans.name: Dúo Bethel Group

texts.es: Dúo Bethel este grupo esta conformado por el señor Moises de 24 años de edad, el posee una tienda donde vende productos de consumo diario, como arroz,frijos,maiz,etc, es un negocio que le a permitido superarse un pococ mas, ya que por la epoca en que cuesta conseguir trabajo decidio dedicarse al negocio, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para surtir su tienda con mas variedad de productos de consumo diario, esperando que ustedes le piedan ayudar con su negocio.
texts.en: The group Dúo Bethel is formed by 24-year-old Moises. He owns a shop where he sells products for everyday consumption, such as rice, beans, and corn. The business has allowed him to get ahead a little more; since it was difficult to get work, he decided to make a living from the business. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase more merchandise to stock his store with a greater variety of products for daily consumption. He is hoping that you will help him with his business.

loans.use: to purchase and sell products for everyday consumption

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio es guarda de seguridad en un mercado capitalino, enviudó hace un mes, y quedó solo con sus hijos. Habita en un barrio marginal de la ciudad. Sus planes son hacer dos cuartos de habitación para darles comodidad a sus hijos, y por eso solicita el crédito para comprar materiales como cemento, arena, bloques, láminas de zinc y perlines, que le permitan empezar la construcción y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Julio is a security guard in a market in the capital. His wife died a month ago and he was left alone with his children. He lives in a neighborhood on the edge of town. His plans are to build two rooms to make his house more comfortable for his children. That is why he is asking for the loan, to buy materials such as cement, sand, blocks, zinc sheeting and rods. These will allow him to start construction and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, sand, blocks, zinc sheeting and rods.

loans.name: Marisol De Los Angeles

texts.es: Marisol es originaria de Managua. Tiene 37 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a brindar el servicio de estilista profesional desde hace 5 años. Inicio esta actividad con dinero propio, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logro establecer su propio salon de belleza, cuenta con una variedad de productos y servicios lo cual ha sido de beneficio para su negocio, ya que ha podido aumentar su clientela. Tiene como otra fuente de ingresos la ayuda económica que le brinda su esposo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de activos fijos como: vitrina, plancha, secadora de cabello, tintes, tijeras, cera, cremas, shampo, fijador entre otros. Estima que este credito sera de mucha ayuda para mejorar su calidad de vida.Su planes futuros son expandir su negocio, mejorar la infraestructura y contratar personal para brindar un  mejor servicio.
texts.en: Marisol is from Managua. She is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She is a merchant and has offered the service of professional hairstyling for 5 years. She started this activity with her own money. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she was able to open her own hairstyling salon. She has a variety of products and services that have been a benefit for her business. She has been able to increase her clientele. She has her husband's financial support as another source of income. She is asking for the loan to buy fixed assets such as a display case, an iron, a hair dryer, dyes, wax, creams, shampoo, hairspray and more. She believes that this loan will be a big help in improving her quality of life. Her plans for the future are to expand her business, improve the infrastructure and hire personnel to offer a better future.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets, such as a display case, an iron, a hair dryer, dyes, scissors, wax, creams, shampoo, hair spray and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and do maintenance on his farm.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is a young agronomist from the village Akhtalyan of the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and grandparents. Hasmik's husband and grandmother work in the government sector. The money they earn in their workplaces is not covering the family's everyday living costs. 

To support the family in earning a living, Hasmik breeds cows and hens. She is also involved in beekeeping with the help of her grandfather. Hasmik and her family are engaged in the cultivation of plants as well; they cultivate wheat, barley, beans, potatoes, apples and nuts. The livestock breeding and the plant cultivation are important sources of income for the family. 

Hasmik and her family need to enlarge the livestock to be able to address the family's growing everyday needs. A loan of USD 3000 will assist them greatly in purchasing two heifers and two calves, as well as some forage for them. Hasmik and her family will be very grateful to the lenders for supporting them and helping them to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two heifers and two calves, as well as some forage for them.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina  is married with four children and two of her children go to school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren). She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chicks and bags of chicken feed.  

Amina generates additional income through selling used clothes. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells to all categories of people, retail.  She generates additional income from rental rooms.  Her major business challenge includes transportation of bags of chicken feed from the markets to her home. Seasonality is also a challenge.  She is aspiring of owning a delivery van to ease transportation and also owning 1000 laying chickens. She resides in the family and the family has access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Ever Diego

texts.es: Ever, a sus 36 años de edad es soltero y no tiene hijos. Debido a una difícil situación económica por la que atravesó luego de quedarse sin empleo, tomó la iniciativa de comenzar a realizar un curso de peluquería en una escuela de belleza, luego decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio para generar los recursos necesarios para el sustento y velar por su futuro. Montó una peluquería en la que ofrece diversos servicios como corte, cepillado, barbería, tratamientos capilares y adicionalmente vende productos de belleza y accesorios. El cliente es un hombre alegre, perseverante, activo y trabajador, a pesar de todos los obstáculos que se le han presentado a nivel económico, él ha sabido manejar la situación y salir adelante. Actualmente solicita el crédito que desea invertir en la compra de insumos, herramientas de trabajo y artículos para la venta (tijeras, cepillos, shampoo, acondicionador, tratamientos capilares, accesorios, gel para el cabello, entre otros) con lo que podrá prestar un mejor servicio y tendrá variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, aumentado las ventas y las ganancias que son el resultado de su labor. De esta forma, Ever podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas, especialmente fortalecer su negocio, acreditarlo y en un futuro a mediano plazo poder abrir otras sucursales, lo que le generará mejores ingresos y podrá disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Ever is 36 years old and is single with no children. When he found himself in a difficult economic situation after being made unemployed, he took the initiative to start a hairdressing course at a beauty school. Then, he decided to go his own way and start his own business to generate income to get by on and plan for the future.

He set up a salon that offers diverse services such as cuts, styling, men's cuts, hair treatments and he additionally sells beauty products and accessories. 

He is a happy, determined, active and hard-working man despite all the financial obstacles that have stood in his way. He has always known how to deal with every situation and move forward. 

He is currently requesting credit that he wants to invest in buying supplies, work tools and items to sell (scissors, brushes, shampoo, conditioner, hair treatments, accessories, hair gel, among others). With these, he will be able to offer a better service and have a variety of products available to satisfy his clients' needs, improving sales and profits as a result of his hard work. 

In this way, Ever will be able to advance towards his goals of strengthening his business, building a strong reputation and in the future not too far ahead be able to open other branches, which would generate more income and allow him to enjoy a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: To buy supplies, work tools and items to sell (scissors, brushes, shampoo, conditioner, hair treatments, accessories, hair gel among others)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cotton and jeans wear.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Please meet Mama, a 45 years old woman who resides in Margibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is a widow and has three children between 26 and 31. All her children are attending college. Her children helped her with some money to established a table market which sells oil, sugar, bread, salt and flour. 

Mama has had this table for the past two years. Her aunt taught her how to sell. Her business is popular. She asking for a loan to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more oil, sugar, bread, salt and flour for her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.es:
Doña Alma tiene 31 años de edad la cual es una mujer que se dedica a la producción de café ella es madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven bajo su mismo techo. En compañía de su esposo se dirigen diariamente a los cultivos de café vecinos en donde ellos se encargan de dar el mantenimiento necesario como: poda, limpia, levantamiento de sombra, fertilización y mantenimiento de cercos ya que de esa manera ellos generan más ingresos para su hogar. Posteriormente se trasladan hasta sus cultivos de café los cuales están ubicados a 45 minutos de su casa de habitación para ser dada la misma atención y así protegerlos de enfermedades como la roya y bichos que puedan deteriorar el grano y la planta en su totalidad. 

Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales con hogares establecidos y sólidos. También sueña con ver poder algún día extender sus cultivos de café comprando más tierra y sembrando una variedad de café atractiva para sus clientes y con un buen precio en el mercado ya que de esa forma ella generara ingresos para su familia y fortalecerá la economía en su hogar. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 20 unidades de nutricafe, 9 unidades de abono 18-46-0 y 4 botes de abono foliar para asistir sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Alma is 31 years old and is a coffee producer. She has 2 children who live with her. Along with her husband, she goes daily to the neighbouring coffee crops where they take care of any necessary maintenance such as: pruning, cleaning, erecting shade, fertilizing and maintaining the fences. In this way, they generate more income for their home. Then, they move onto other coffee crops that they have 45 minutes from their one-bedroom house to give them the same attention and protect them from diseases such as rust or bugs that can deteriorate the grain and the entire plant. 

She dreams of seeing her children working in professional jobs with stable, solid homes. She also dreams of one day being able to extend her coffee crops to buy more land and sow a variety of attractive coffee for her clients. She would like to be able to sell it for a good price in the market so she would receive more income for her family and strengthen her home's economic situation. 

Therefore, today she is requesting finance with which she will buy 20 units of nutricafe, 9 units of manure 18-46-0 and 4 tubs of fertilizer to help her coffee grow.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en:
Kyalo is a 39-year-old married man. He has 3 children, with ages ranging from 2 to 14 years. He operates a retail business where he sells artifacts. His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents and tourists.

Kyalo has been facing a hygiene problem due to lack of an adequate storage facility. Hence, he plans to use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase water storage equipment which will be used by his extended family of ten people. His business goal is to improve the living standards of his family within 5 years. He is an industrious and hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase water storage equipment

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is from the village Byurakn of the Shirak region. He lives with his mother, wife, son and daughter. Manvel's family members, except for his daughter, work in the village school. However their salaries alone are not enough to meet the family's everyday living costs. 

The most important source of family's income is the livestock of cows, sheep and hens, as well as the cultivation of wheat, barley and potatoes. The barn of the livestock is currently in poor conditions and needs to be renovated. Manvel and his family need to make some investments in the renovation of the barn in order to breed the livestock more effectively. They need a loan of USD 3000 to renovate the barn and to buy some forage for the livestock. The family will be grateful, and the lenders support will be highly appreciated in helping the family to run their agribusiness in a more efficient way.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the barn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to look after coffee crops and to buy fertiliser.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda es una mujer  casada de 25  años de edad  vive junto a sus 2 hijos  los cuales son; 1 hombre y 1 mujer en el Caserío Las Minas, San José Chacayá, Sololá.
Ella es  una persona amable y sobre todo trabajadora, actualmente  se dedica a elaborar  blusas típicas que utilizan las mujeres  indígenas de su región. 
Ella  inicio este trabajo hace 2  años, ya que su suegra le enseño a realizar este tipo de actividad, que hasta el momento le ha permitido  sacar adelante a su familia a través de los ingresos y ganancias que obtiene en esta labor.
Comenta que ha observado que en este tipo de negocio existe mucha demanda, por lo  que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,300.00 para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y tela para poder elaborar las blusas y así ofrecerles más variedades a sus clientes con el fin de incrementar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es tener un local en donde pueda exhibir las blusas típicas que elabora,  ya que de esta manera podrá mejorar la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Florinda is 25 years old and married.  She lives with her son and daughter in Las Minas in San José, Chacayá, Sololá.

Florinda is friendly and, above all, hard-working.  She currently makes a living producing typical blouses, which are worn by the indigenous women of the region.  Florinda started this work two years ago after her mother-in-law taught her how to do it.  This work has allowed Florinda to help her family to get ahead with the income and profits that she earns from this work.

Florinda tells us that there is a lot of demand for this work and so she is applying for a loan of 4,300 Qetzal in order to buy different coloured threads and material in order to produce the blouses.  With this loan, she will be able to offer a greater variety of blouses to her customers and so increase her profits.

Florinda's dream is to have her own promises where she can exhibit the typical blouses.  With this she would be able to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy threads and material to make typical blouses.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has two children aged 1 year and 6 years. She describes herself as self-driven and business oriented. She operates a farm and beauty salon where she provides hair dressing services and farming. 
Mercy describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient water which is used by her family. She will use the 31000 KES (Kenyan shilling) loan to buy a water tank. Her business goal is to improve her living standard for her family within five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Raphaela

texts.en: Raphaela is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 19 years to 37 years. She describes herself to be honest and determined in her business. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She describes her biggest challenge to be lack of enough clean water . She will use the Kes 31,000 loan to buy a water tank . Her business goal is to improve her living standard of her family within five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be a jovial woman. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation problems during the rainy season. 

Jane will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase charcoal. Her business goal is to run two more charcoal retail stores within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 27-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged 3 and 7 years. She describes herself to be warm and kind. She operates a general store where she sells items such as detergent, margarine, bread, etc. Her business is located near a busy slum and her primary customers are residents from the slum.

Jane is faced with a challenge of insufficient water storage and therefore plans to use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase water storage equipment which will be used by her family. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase a water storage container

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be a determined and hardworking woman.  She operates a poultry and general store business where she sells chicken and household items. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a convenient cooker.

She will use the 12,900 KES loan to buy a gas cooker. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
Mesrop is a farmer from the village Gnshik of Vayots Dzor region. His family consists of his wife and son. Mesrop is the head of the community of Gnshik village. He and his family are engaged in cattle breeding, beekeeping and cultivation of apricots, apples, pears and nuts. Those are very important sources of income for the family.

 Mesrop and his family are very successful and known for beekeeping; they not only sell the honey in the local market, but have a demand outside of their community. They currently want to enlarge their cattle breeding as well. To reach that goal, Mesrop needs a loan of USD 1500 to purchase two calves. The hard-working family will be thankful to all the lenders for their goodwill in assisting them to sustain their agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 19 years old and lives in the area of Airport. She is single and a Grade 9 dropout. She is determined to make her life a better one by getting engaged in the sale of clothes and cosmetics. Nelia has been in this business for four years now, and she enjoys the flow of her customers.

Nelia is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes and cosmetics for her business. Her dream is to become an international businesswoman in the nearest future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: José Atilio

texts.es:
José de 54 años,  es una persona que solo estudio hasta sexto grado, es casado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y han procreado tres hijos.

Él se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa  e hijos quienes dependen de las actividades que él realiza. Se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería oficio que aprendió de sus padres.  Para llegar a la parcelas camina 2 Km  y trabaja junto a su esposa durante la mañana y luego en el transcurso de la tarde ordeña sus vacas para producir queso, crema. Etc. Que su esposa sale a vender

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  dos vacas lecheras, que le incrementaran la producción de leche y obtendrá mejores ingresos con la venta para el sustento de su familia.

Él planea comprar un vehículo para hacer viajes en su lugar de residencia y en los alrededores, ya que no entra ningún bus al lugar y el único medio de transporte es a pie.
texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old José only studied up to the end of sixth grade.  He is married; his wife is a housewife and they have three children together.

José gets up at 5am with his wife and children, who depend on José's work.  José works in farming and cattle raising, a trade that he learned from his parents.  In order to get to his land, José walks for two kilometres and works with his wife in the morning.  Later in the afternoon he milks the cows in order to make cheese, creams, and the like, which his wife goes out to sell.

José is applying for a loan to buy two dairy cows in order to increase his milk products and to increase his income through sales.  This will help maintain the family.

José is planning to buy a vehicle in order to travel from his home to the surrounding areas as their is no public transport and he must go everywhere by foot.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Together We Can Group

texts.en:
Aminah, a single mother of five children, has struggled single-handedly to provide their basic needs and pay tuition for them. With small capital of 200,000, she started roadside vending of clothes to help her meet their needs. Later, with the help of a loan, she rented a small place from which she sells used clothing. Together with the other women, she has approached UGAFODE to get a loan which she will use to pay tuition for her children, who are about to sit their end-of-year exams. She is confident the loan will help her children to settle in school and concentrate on their books instead of being sent away from school for not paying tuition.

In the photo are group members with the UGAFODE credit officer (front row extreme right in a white blouse).

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Hasbon

texts.en:
Hasbon is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a bicycle transport business where he provides transportation services. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough water.

He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a water tank. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM after repaying successfully a previous loan of 10,000 KES.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay coffee cutters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 59-year-old mixed farmer. John is married to Sarah, a farmer, and they are blessed with one child. John has been farming for the past twenty-five years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which he uses for his family’s upkeep. 

John is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to start his own hotel (in Africa, the word "hotel" often refers to a cafe or restaurant) to increase on his daily income.  With the expected profit from the business, he will expand his hotel and improve the living standards of his family. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a good life and improve his farming standards.

loans.use: to start his own hotel

loans.name: Pedro De Jesús

texts.es:
Pedro de 61 años, es una persona casada; con su esposa no tuvieron hijos, estudio hasta noveno grado.    
se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para prepararse para ir a las parcelas donde cultivan y luego se dedica  a trabajar en otras parcelas para llevar el sustento a su esposa quien esta  enferma. Desde hace, varios años se dedica a la agricultura , oficio que aprendió de sus  padres. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una  vaca lechera para producir leche  y generar más ingresos para el sustento de su esposa,  ya que ella debe alimentarse bien y le han recomendado consumir leche. Él planea en un futuro poder compra más vacas y producir leche para la venta.
texts.en:
Pedro, 61, is married but has no children. He studied up to the ninth grade. He wakes up at 5:00 am and gets ready to work on their plantations. Then he takes care of other plantations in order to support his wife, who is sick. He has been working for years in agriculture, an activity he learned from his parents.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow, produce milk and increase his income in order to keep supporting his wife, who needs to eat better and was advised to drink milk. His plans for the future are to buy more cows and produce milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and produce milk.

loans.name: Mary Jakeline

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Mary, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 10 y 9 años, el mayor estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en construcción.

Doña Mary para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y al ver que su marido no gana lo suficiente solicito uno de los créditos con el cual adecuo un pequeño local en su casa en el mismo que surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, recién la tiene dos años pero que a pesar de tener tan poco tiempo le da buenas ganancias y satisfacciones, ella con cada crédito que recibe compra más productos y así satisface a su  clientela, a ella le gusta su labor ya que se gana algo y está atenta a lo que sus hijos necesitan.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, aceites  y otros víveres para surtir su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal más de 11 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora comunal bank meets every two weeks in the Sequita parish, which is part of the Montecristi Prospero settlement, full of hardworking, dedicated people who are proud of their roots.  Sequita is one of the parishes where its inhabitants are honest and only know how to work and be dedicated to their families.

Mary lives here.  She is 36 years old, married, and has three children, ages 13, 10, and 9.  The oldest attends high school and the others attend school.  Her husband works in construction.

Mary used the money from a loan to set up a small food store in her home two years ago, so she could help her husband out with the household expenses, because he does not earn enough.  Despite not having been open for long, it has produced good earning and satisfaction.  She buys more merchandise with each loan and satisfies her customers.  She likes her work because she can earn something and also care for her children.

She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other food to stock her store.  She has been with the communal bank for more than 11 years and she likes it because the loans are helpful.

Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es: Sonia, es madre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad y estudiantes. Su mayor anhelo como madre es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en personas de bien, pone todo su esfuerzo en su educación. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación, también vende cuajada y gaseosas. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de materia prima como 6 quintales de maíz, leña.
texts.en:
Sonia is the mother of 4 children. All are young students. Her greatest desire as a mother is to be able to see her children become good people and put all of their efforts into their education.

She makes a living by making and selling tortillas in her home. She also sells cheese curds and sodas.

She requests this loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials, like 6 quintales of corn and firewood.

loans.use: to buy 6 quintales of corn and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Bobosharif

texts.ru:
Бобошариф зарабатывает тем, что производит мебель, окно и двери. Он мебельщик. В Турсунзаде производят хорошую и качественную мебель на заказ. Занимается этим делом Бобошариф более 10 лет. Ему всего 29 лет, а он уже женат и имеет детей. Все что он делает, он делает ради своей семьи. Семья у Бобошарифа большая, он живет с родителями. Бобошарифу необходимо построить одну комнату в дворе дома, чтобы было просторно и уютно жить. 
Бобошариф берет кредит на сумму 2 000 долларов США для приобретения строительных материалов и сырья для производства. Он намерен совместить приятное с полезным. Он верит в вашу доброту. Сейчас дома у Бобошарифа полный бардак. Получив кредит он сможет достроить дом и увеличить количество производимого продукта, а также улучшить его качество.
texts.en:
Bobosharif earns a living by producing furniture, windows, and doors. He is a furniture maker. In Tursun-zoda, he produces good and quality furniture to order. Bobosharif has been engaged in this kind of work for more than ten years. He is only 29, but he is already married and has children. Everything that he does, he does for his family. Bobosharif has a large family and he lives with his parents. Bobosharif needs to build one room in the yard, in order to be more spacious and comfortable to live.

Bobosharif is taking a loan of US $2,000 for the purchase of construction and raw materials for production. He intends to combine business with pleasure. At the moment, Bobosharif's home is a complete mess. By receiving a loan, he will be able to complete the home and to increase the amount of production, and similarly to improve its quality.

loans.use: to complete construction of a home and to purchase the needed raw materials for production

loans.name: Domiana

texts.en:
Domiana is 45 years old, married to Mwanzia and they have four children who are in school.

She has a business of selling clothes in Naivasha that she has operated for three years. She has applied for a third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy more stock of clothes for sale. She plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, she hopes to see her children well educated.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 44 years old, married to Dorothea and they have two children who are in school.

He has a grocery in Naivasha that he has operated for three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to buy tomatoes after paying his previous loan on time. With the anticipated profit he plans to pay school fees.

He hopes to expand his business to be financially stable in the near future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Sulma Yaneth

texts.es:
Sulma de 27 años de edad,  estudio hasta educación media, esta acompañada; su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijas que van a la escuela y quienes depende de las actividades que ellos realizan.
 
Ella se dedica a trabajar en una empresa avicola, durante todo el día y su esposo camina 3 Km para llegar a la parcela que cultiva y su hijas durante la mañana van a la escuela y en la tarde que llegan, se dedican a las labores domesticas, mientras su compañero de vida, se dedica a cuidar otras parcelas

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cemento, polines, lamina, etc, que necesita para arreglar el techo de su vivienda

Ella planea ampliar más su vivienda, ya que su familia va creciendo y necesita más espacio para la comodidad de la familia.
texts.en:
Sulma is 27 years old and has a secondary school education. She lives in a common law marriage; her life partner works in agriculture. She wakes up at 4:30 a.m. along with her partner and their three daughters, who go to school and depend on the work that their parents do.
 
She works at a poultry business all day. Her husband walks 3 kilometers to the plot of land that he farms. Their daughters go to school in the morning and do household chores when they arrive home in the afternoon, while her husband cares for other plots of land.

The loan that she seeks from Fundación Campo will be used to buy cement, lumber, sheet metal, etc. to repair the roof of her home.

She plans to expand her home, since her family is growing and needs more space to be comfortable.

loans.use: to buy cement, lumber, sheet metal, etc. to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Muyisa Group

texts.en:
Yango is 48 years old, and she is the president of the “Muyisa” group. She is the mother of 10 children, who all study. Her husband is a teacher. 

She sells second-hand clothes.  She started this activity five years ago with funds received from her husband. This activity helps her in the heavy responsibility of paying school fees for her children. 

This new loan will allow her to buy seven bundles of second-hand clothes in order to increase her profit. 

In the future, Yango wishes to buy a compound and to support school fees for her children. Her gratitude is addressed to Hekima for its microfinance services.

loans.use: to buy seven bundles of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Saqo

texts.en: Saqo is from the village of Angeghakot in the Syuniq region. He lives with his parents. Saqo is the only breadwinner of the family. He is a contractual serviceman in the army. Unfortunately, however, his salary alone is not enough to cover the basic needs of the family. The most important source of income is the family's cows and pigs and the cultivation of wheat, beech, potatoes, apples, pears and nuts. Saqo's parents help him a lot with the farming activities. Saqo currently is eager to develop his agribusiness. To reach that goal, he needs a loan of 3000 USD to purchase three calves, some forage for the cattle, and fuel for the agricultural machinery and to pay for the harvesting services. Saqo and his family will be grateful to all the lenders for the support in gathering the needed amount of money to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a forty-four-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling cosmetics for twelve years and the business is so lucrative since women are his major clients. The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to university and set up sustainable income generating activities for them. Inadequate capital and price fluctuations are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a beauty parlor. Solomon intends to use this loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a  Kiva borrower. She has three children. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within a viable place for the business, and her primary customers are residents from her area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 20,000 KES [Kenyan shillings] loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a big boutique within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eucevia

texts.es:
Eucevia es una mujer de 30 años de edad casada madre de 8 hijos de los cuales con ella solo viven 4 ya que los otros 4 están en hogares aparte. Desde niña aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que en su familia la agricultura es una tradición adquiriendo el conocimiento por medio de sus padres quienes también son agricultores especializándose en el cultivo de café y la cría de animales. En compañía de su esposo y 2 de los hijos que aún viven con ella se involucran en sus cultivos de café dando mantenimiento y asistencia como limpieza, poda, aplicación de fertilizantes, insecticidas y abonos para mantener sus cultivos sanos y protegidos de bichos y enfermedades como la roya. La tierra que en familia trabajan está ubicada a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan diariamente caminando o en vestía.

Sus planes a futuro son los de poder ampliar más su tierra fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos heredando a cada uno de ellos una parcela de tierra para que puedan construir sus hogares o seguir con la agricultura ya que de esa manera ellos fortalecerán la economía de sus hogares, construirán un techo digno para sus hijos y nietos. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos de café como abono, formula cafetalera, fertilizantes para dar asistencia a los mismos.
texts.en:
Eucevia is thirty years old, is married, and has eight children.  Only four of her children presently live with her; the others live in separate homes.

When she was a young girl, she learned to work the land.  Agriculture is a tradition in her family, and she acquired the knowledge for farming through her parents, who grow coffee and raise livestock.  In the company of her husband and two of her children still living at home, she maintains her coffee  by cleaning, pruning, and applying fertilizers, insecticides, and manure to her crops.  This keeps her crops healthy and protected from pests and plant diseases, like la roya [coffee rust].  The land where she works with her family is located 2 km from her home.  They generally travel to and from the farm every day by walking or by horse.

Her future plans are to grow her farm, thereby strengthening the inheritance she will have to eventually offer her children.  She hopes that each of her children will inherit a parcel of land where they can build their homes or continue with farming.  In this way, they can have a means of income and build a dignified house for both their children and grandchildren.  

For these reasons, she is requesting financing in order to purchase farming supplies for her coffee crops.  She will buy items like manure, special coffee fertilizer, and other fertilizers that will help her crops.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is 35 years old, married and blessed with with one child, age 3 years and eight months. She also supports a family of three members. Her main source of income is that she grinds livestock feeds. That earns her an income of KES 4,500 monthly. She also owns a spare parts shop.

She has borrowed a third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET Ltd. and intends to pay school fees for her two dependents for whom she cares. The profits she earns from both of her businesses will be used to expand both of the businesses and also repay the loan.

Her dream is to expand her business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 28-year-old farmer from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married, with four children ages 1 to 12 years. Her husband works as a security guard. 

She has been farming for eight years now, and her farming business earns her an average income of PHP 3,000 per month for her family. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm, so she can help provide for her children.

Her income also helps with food and school fees.

In the future, she hopes to have other business opportunities and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Jabbor

texts.ru: У Джаббора высшае образование, но по специальности он так и не смог найти работу. Джаббор отец пятерых детей. У него трое сыновей и двое дочерей. Почти все его дети обзавелись семьями. Один из сыновей Джаббора работает в России и материально помогает им. Сейчас Джаббору 49 лет, он хочет купить автомашину и начать работать таксистом на родном районе Хамадони. У него двухлетний водительский стаж. В Хамадони очень мало машин и других средств передвижения. Джаббор имеется сбережения но его не достаточно для покупки автомашины. Поэтому он берет кредит для приобретения автомашины. Он хочет хоть немножко помочь землякам с транспортом.
texts.en:
Jabbor has a higher education, but he has been unable to find a job in his specialty. Jabbor is the father of five children. He has three sons and two daughters. Almost all of his children are now married. One of Jabbor's sons works in Russia and helps him financially. Now Jabbor is 49 years old. 

He wants to buy an automobile and to start working as a taxi driver in his native region Hamadoni. He has two years of driving experience. In Hamadoni, there are very few cars and other vehicles. Jabbor has savings but it is not enough to buy a car. Therefore, he is taking a loan to purchase an automobile. He wants to offer a little help to his countrymen with transportation.

loans.use: to acquire an automobile, in order to provide a little help to his fellow countrymen with transportation

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is 52 years old, married to Alice and a father of seven children between 30 and 8 years of age. 

He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last 20 years with a monthly income of KES 36,000. He is servicing his third loan of KES 40,000 from KADET and this will help him in preparation of the farm and purchasing of inputs.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to build his family a permanent house. His future dream is to improve the family's living standards and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Alberta earns additional income from an Internet café.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like snack foods, milk, coffee, biscuits, noodles, etc. in her general store.

Alberta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like snack foods, milk, coffee, biscuits, noodles, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 32-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 9 years to 13 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. 

He operates a retail store and a motorcycle business in which he sells household items and provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a profitable business area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the inflation of fuel prices. 

He will use the 20,000 KES [Kenyan shillings] loan to purchase household items. His business goal is to restock his retail store within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM after paying his previous loan of 40,000 KES successfully.

loans.use: to purchase household items for his retail store.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is an experienced farmer from the village of Sarigyugh of the Tavush region. She lives with her elderly mother, husband and daughter. She and her husband are the ones who take care of the family. Susanna's husband is renovating musical instruments. 

The most important source of the family's income is the livestock of cows, piglets and hens, and the cultivation of wheat, corn, beans, potatoes, grass and several fruits (plum, fig, blood orange, apple, pear and nuts). As the family’s needs are growing day by day, they need to enlarge their agribusiness a bit to be able to live on it. 

Susanna needs a loan of $3,000 to purchase three more piglets and three heifers, and to pay for the harvesting activities. The hardworking family will be very grateful to all the lenders for their support in gathering the needed amount of financial resources for sustaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three more piglets and three heifers, and to pay for the harvesting activities.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 62-year-old married man from Jenin city. He is a father for six sons and three daughters. Mahmoud has a clothes store for women in the city. It is a profitable business, but always needs development and improvement. Mahmoud's wife is an employee in the public sector. She gets a very low income, but she helps her husband with part of the family expenses.
 
Mahmoud requested a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more stock at a very low price for his clothes store. This will improve the store and also increase his income. 

Mahmoud appears in the photo while he was in his store.

loans.use: to buy more stock at a very low price for his clothes store.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Каждому человеку приятно, когда он находит свою работу и выполняет его с удовольствием. Каждый день идти на работу, как на праздник. Особенно приятно если свою профессию знать с детства и идти к нему с ранних лет. Вот Дилафруз повезло. Она с юных лет любила готовить и печь разные виды сладостей. И до сих пор готовит, потому что она кондитер. Она знает все о кондитерских изделий. Больше всего она любит печь торты. Тот, кто попробовал ее торты был приятно удивлен. Она научилась готовить вместе со своей сестрой, которая тоже кондитер, но ее сестре больше нравиться готовить кексы и бисквиты. Две девочки так любили готовить, что их тяга к вкусному и красивому превратила их в настоящих мастериц. В данный момент Дилафруз запрашивает кредит для ремонта цеха. После ремонта помещении станет просторнее, и ей будет удобно работать в новой обстановке.
texts.en:
For every person it is pleasant when she finds her work and performs it with pleasure; to go to work every day like it is a holiday. It is especially nice if one has known her profession since childhood and to go with it from an early age. 

Here Dilafruz has been lucky. From a young age, she has loved to cook and bake different kinds of sweets. And she still cooks because she is a pastry chef. She knows all about baking pastries. Most of all, she loves to bake cakes. Anyone who has tried her cakes has been pleasantly surprised. She learned to cook from her sister who is also a pastry chef, but her sister likes cooking pies and biscuits more. The two young women so love to cook that their craving for delicious and beautiful things has turned them into real masters. 

Currently, Dilafruz is requesting a loan for repairs to the pastry shop. After the repairs, the place will be spacious and it will be comfortable for her to work in a new environment.

loans.use: to repair her pastry shop

loans.name: Nympha

texts.en:
Nympha is a 36-year-old woman who is married with one young son. Her husband works abroad to make sure that they can have a good future. She in turn helps by engaging in a cellphone accessory business since three years ago. She sell cellphone batteries, SIM packs, chargers, casing and cellphone holders.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, cellphone casing, cellphone holders, batteries and SIM packs. This is her only way of showing her support to her husband so they can have a good life.

In the future, she hopes to make her business bigger and send her son to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, cell phone casing, cellphone holders, batteries and SIM packs.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 48 years old and married with four children, ages 9-17. She is a hardworking woman who has been engaged in several small businesses like a sari-sari (variety) store, fishing, catching crabs and selling fresh fish for 20 years now.  

She is motivated to do everything to earn a living for her children together with her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy fresh fish, sacks of rice and canned goods. 

This will help so that she will never run out of stock, thus, maximizing her profit.

In the future, she dreams of seeing her children all successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, sacks of rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is a 34-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 7-15. Edelyn works hard to help her husband in fishing and catching crabs to provide for their family. Whatever they catch, she also selsl. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and crab traps that will help them to be more productive.

In the future, she hopes that all her children will graduate from college as a result of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and crab traps.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
For ten years now, Erlinda has been engaged in raising hogs. She lives in Talibon, Bohol with her adult children. Aside from raising hogs, she also sells lotion, perfumes, massage oil and other products from Avon.

She is asking for a loan to invest more in her business. The loan will be used to buy piglets, lotion and massage oil. Erlinda is hopeful that with the additional capital she will have a better profit that will continue to support her basic household needs.

In the future, Erlinda hopes to have a bigger business and a more sustainable one.

loans.use: to buy piglets, lotion and massage oil.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a 47-year-old from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with a 9-year-old daughter to support. Leonila has been engaged in fishing and catching crabs. She is asking for a loan to buy bamboo which will be used to make crab traps. This in turn will make their work easier and allows them to be more productive.

She is optimistic that her hard work will pay off and she will be able to really help her husband who works as a carpenter. It is her dream, too, to see her daughter be successful someday through proper education.

loans.use: to buy bamboo

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is 30 years old. He lives in Ijevan city with his wife, son and daughter. Vahe has no higher education, but he perfectly manages to provide his small family with normal living conditions. 

Vahe has a crane of his own, which is very often rented for doing construction work and for transferring heavy loads. Vahe is a hardworking person and loves his family very much and he is doing his best to enlarge his family income.
 
He asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to buy six tires for his crane and some other car spare parts. He already twice has taken loans from Nor Horizon and he has paid them back successfully.

loans.use: to buy six tires for his crane and some other car spare parts.

loans.name: Jepkorir

texts.en:
Jepkorir is a married lady, age 44 and blessed with a family of five that she supports. She owns a posho mill in Perkera and has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of KES 12,000 by providing the services.

She is now servicing her third loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. and wishes to use this amount to pay school fees for her children. The anticipated amounts from the posho mill will be used to purchase business stock of dry maize and millet for grinding and reselling.

Her dream is live happily and also succeed in her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Ma. Merlin

texts.en:
Ma. Merlin is a 39-year-old woman from the community of Talibon, Bohol. This town offers mostly fishing for its residents' livelihood, for it is located near many islands. Ma. Merlin is engaged in fishing and catching crabs to provide for her three children, ages 2, 9 and 10. Her husband is also into fishing and they work hard together for their children.

She is asking for a loan to buy fish net, nylon and crab traps. She hopes that with all her hard work, she will be able to send her children to school so that they can have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy fish net, nylon and crab traps.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Mbalu from Port loko. She is married with seven children between the ages of 4 years and 21 years. Five of her children are currently attending school.

Mbalu runs a retail business; she sells ketchup, sardines, mayonnaise, cooking oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. At present, her major problem is the slow purchasing power of customers.

Mbalu has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities like sardines, mayonnaise, cooking oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family. In the future, she plans to educate her children up to university. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more food commodities like sardines, mayonnaise, cooking oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo while he was working in his grocery store.

Salam is a 20-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus city. She lives with her husband in a simple home. Salam's husband owns a small grocery store in the village, where he sells basic goods like rice, sugar and dairy milk. It is a very profitable project, but needs a lot of improvement. This store has been opened since one year ago.
 
Salam took a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to expand his grocery store and buy more products to resell. This will improve his business and increase the family income.

loans.use: to expand the grocery store and buy more products to resell.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.es:
Ananias, de 48 años de edad, está casado con Jazmín quien trabaja como empleada y es madre de sus 3 hijos 15 años,  08 años y 04 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. Ananias se dedica a dar el servicio de alquiler  de  transporte de carga dentro de la ciudad, para lo cual cuenta con una unidad de transporte pesado, que adquirió con el apoyo de su pareja, y lo alquilan  a una persona responsable que le paga por día trabajado.Se inició hace más de 05 años, comprando su vehículo con los ahorros mutuos con su esposa, quien conduce en sus ratos libres. Se decido empezar con su negocio por el deseo de contar con sus propios ingresos y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, considerando que así lograrán progresar más rápidamente.
Por tanto, viendo los resultados de sus negocios, tiene deseos de continuar y aumentar el número de unidades vehiculares. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de repuestos de motos como llantas y otros para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras.
texts.en:
Ananias is forty-eight years old and is married to Jazmín.  Jazmín works and is also the mother of his three children, ages 15, 8, and 4.  They all live together in a house that they own.  Ananias makes a living offering a cargo rental service within the city.  For this work, he has a heavy transport vehicle that he acquired with the support of his wife.  Sometimes they hire a responsible person to drive it, and they pay him for each day worked.  Ananias began this work more than five years ago, buying the vehicle with mutual savings with his wife, who also drives the vehicle in her free time.  He decided to begin his business because he wanted to have his own income and to be able to support his wife with the home expenses, feeling that in doing this, they would be able to advance themselves more rapidly.  

Seeing the results of his business, he hopes to continue and to grow the number of vehicles he has.  This is his first loan with Kiva, and he feels grateful for the financial support that he receives in order to continue moving forward.  He promises to pay his installments on time.

With the amount he has requested (1500 soles), he will invest in the purchase of spare parts for his vehicle, like tires and other parts.  He will be able to maintain the vehicle and to search for the best prices for the parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his cargo transport vehicle, like tires, bolts, and other items.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru:
Озода проживает в районе Вахдат. Она три года назад со своей сестрой открыла цех по выпечке кондитерских изделий. Открытия маленького цеха, но зато своего стало для них настоящим достижением, потому что они к тому долго шли. 
Озода с детства любили печь разные сладости. Ее хобби стало настоящим увлечением, профессией и средством дохода. Озода работает по части выпечки кексов и бисквитов. Озода надеется в цехе скоро станет лучше, когда она сделает ремонт и приобретет новое оборудование для выпечки. Это даст ей возможность расшириться и увеличить ассортимент продукции. С такими планами она идет вперед с верой и надеждой. Без спорно она достойна этого.
texts.en:
Ozoda resides in the Vahdat region. Three years ago, she opened a bakery with her sister to prepare sweets. The opening of a small shop was a real achievement for them because they were going toward that for a long time. 

Since childhood, Ozoda has loved to bake different sweets. Her hobby has become a real passion, a profession, and a means of income. Ozoda works on the part of baking pies and biscuits. Ozoda hopes the shop will soon be better when she will make repairs and acquire new baking equipment. This will give her the opportunity to expand and increase the range of products. With these plans, she is moving forward with faith and hope. Without argument, she deserves it.

loans.use: to purchase the needed equipment for baking

loans.name: Matirida

texts.en:
Matirida is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.   

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT - SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season), which hinders her movements, and the ever-increasing prices of charcoal. She is hoping to get a delivery van and also to buy a plot of land. She resides in her own house where the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Marivie

texts.en:
This is Marivie, 31, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Joenard, a driver, and she is the mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marivie oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Marivie hopes to succeed in life and business. She dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.
