Helen would like to successfully expand her business to meet family commitments, like educating her children and savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer soltera de 23  años de edad  vive junto a su hijo de 3 años en el Sector Centro, Santa Cruz La Laguna, Sololá.
Ella es  una persona trabajadora que lucha por darle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de cortes típicos, que son utilizados por las mujeres indígenas de su comunidad. 
Comenta que desde hace 13 años viene realizando esta labor, ya que cuando era pequeña su madre le enseño este oficio, que hasta el momento le ha generado ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le han ayudado a contribuir en la economía de su familia.
Ahora ella ve la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de hilos de varios colores para la elaboración de los cortes tipicos,  ya que cada día va en  aumento este tipo de negocio.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias a través de su negocio, con el propósito de ahorrar para poder construir su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de  vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 23-year old single mother who lives with her 3-year old son in the Sector Centro, Santa Cruz La Laguna, Sololá.

She is a hardworking person who does the best she can to provide for her family. She currently earns her living making the traditional clothing worn by the indigenous women of her community. It's work that she's been doing for thirteen years as when she was a young girl, her mother taught her how to embroider. It's generated a reasonable income and profit over the years so she has been able to contribute to household finances.

Now Cristina is seeking a loan of Q3,000.00 to buy different coloured thread to make the clothing as each day brings an increase in business. Her dream is generate more income through her business so she can save enough money to build a house and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy thread to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 28-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; two of her children are too young and fully dependent upon their parents. Her other two children go to school; it is very difficult for her to provide her children higher education. She wants to make some savings so that she could provide a higher education to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of  a profitable source of income. 

In fact, her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years and he earns as much as their expenses are. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw body, but he does not have sufficient funds to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Samina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to repair the auto rickshaw body. 

Samina hopes that she would be able to save enough till her children are grown and she would be successful in providing a higher education to her children.

loans.use: For the maintenance of their auto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a 54-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol, in the Philippines.   He is married and has four adult children. 

Jose has been a farmer for a long time, ever since his children were younger. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. He usually earned PHP 3,500 per month from farming. 

Jose works hard to sustain his farm. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer. He hopes to expand the land that he cultivates in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William used his previous loan to buy cassava to sell.  He is a 44-year-old married man, with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda.

He has been in the cassava-milling business for four years.  With his earnings he was able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. He also has tree nursery beds, and he supplies tree seedlings to farmers around the area.

His family goal is to educate his children up to the university, while his business plans are to buy more land to plant more trees and to diversify his business so he can mill other cereals, like beans and maize.  

William intends to use the loan to buy a coffee-milling machine.

loans.use: to buy a coffee-milling machine

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a forty-seven-year-old married man with nine children living in Kasese,Uganda. For seven years he has been in agriculture and he also earns a monthly salary as a teacher. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification and set up sustainable income generating activities. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation affect his business growth while his plans are to venture into modern farming methods. Augustine intends to use the money to buy seeds, rent land to farm on and buy agrochemicals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, rent land to farm on and buy agrochemicals.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a forty-two-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese,Uganda. He has been in the transport business for thirteen years, practices agriculture and also operates a salon. The high cost of fuel and poor roads are his major challenges while his dreams are buying a bus, educating his children up to the university level and building a permanent residential house. Musa intends to use the loan to buy building materials such as bricks and sand.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks and sand.

loans.name: Ester Lidia

texts.es:
Doña Ester es una mujer casada y madre de 5 hijos los cuales viven con ella y su esposo y contribuyen en las diferentes labores que diariamente se realizan en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café como; poda, limpieza, aplicación de fertilizantes, abono, foliares, etc. que dan una mayor protección y seguridad a sus cultivos de café. Ella tiene una edad de 42 años y un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo financiero y moral por parte de sus padres. Ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este rubro el cual aprendió por medio de una capacitación que recibió por medio de una institución para que ellos pudiesen llevar a cabo la siembra y cultivo de café. La tierra que en familia trabajan es propia adquirida con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio la cual está ubicada a 5 minutos de camino de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie involucrándose en la misma solo ellos como familia. 

Sus metas son las de poder ser la mejor productora de café de la zona mejorando la calidad, implementando métodos que lleven a la disminución de costos de mantenimiento y produciendo un grano de café atractivo y a buen precio de tal manera que pueda ser exportado del país. Como madre apoyar a sus hijos en la educación preparándolos para que sean mejores personas en la vida, mejores hombres y mujeres y que no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, formula cafetalera que den una mejor y mayor protección a sus cultivos para obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Esther’s married and mother of five children who live with her and her husband and help with the various daily chores  like pruning, weeding, fertilizing, applying manure, leaf fertilizer, etc. that need to be done to maintain, better protect and keep secure the coffee crop.  She’s 42-years-old and completed primary school.  She was able to complete it thanks to her parents’ financial and moral support.  She’s been in this line of work for 10 years having learned it from training courses she got at an institution so that they would be able to crow and harvest coffee.  The land they work as a family was acquired with much effort and sacrifice and is located 5 minutes away from home; they reach it on foot and they work there by themselves as a family.

Her goal is to be able to become the best coffee producer in the zone improving its quality and implementing methods that will reduce production costs and produce an attractive coffee bean at a good price so that it can be exported from the country.

As a mother, to support her children’s schooling preparing them to become better persons in life, better men and women who won’t go through the same situation she did in her youth.  This is why today she’s asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like manure, leaf fertilizer and coffee formula that will yield more and better protection for her crops so that harvest will be good.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 42 años vive junto a su esposo Octavio y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia hecha con bloques de adobe.
Creció en el campo y fuerons sus padres quienes siempre se dedicaron a la vida agrícola cultivando diversos productos rentables de su zona tales como cacao, café, achiote y palillo; siendo estos los principales productos de su zona. Tiene mas de  20 años desempeñándose de manera independiente con el firme apoyo de su esposo con quien tiene el agrado de trabajar con mucho ímpetu para el bienestar de su familia.
Le agrada su labor puesto que esta acostumbrada a las actividades agrícolas. No obstante ha tenido que lidiar con distintos problemas tales como el ataque de plagas, enfermedades del cacao; entre otros que muchas veces llega a perjudicar su producción de la campaña vigente. Para el normal desempeño de su trabajo cuenta en muchas ocasiones con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar a quienes paga para culminar las tareas complicadas tales como el retiro de maleza y recolección de los frutos maduros en la cosecha. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales que le faciliten construir una pequeña vivienda dentro de sus terrenos para si cuidar sus cultivos en días previos a la cosecha.
texts.en:
Mery, 42, lives with her husband, Octavio, and their four children in their own house made of adobe blocks. She grew up in the countryside. Her parents always farmed, growing profitable crops like cacao, coffee, annatto, and palillo, which are the main local products. She has been farming independently for 20 years. With support from her husband, with whom she has the pleasure of working, she has made a great effort to improve their family's well being. Mery likes her work because she is used to farming. However, she has had to face some problems like insect infestations and cacao diseases that many times threaten seasonal production. She often hires local workers to do harder tasks such as weeding and harvesting mature pods.

This is her third loan cycles with Kiva, and she is grateful for the funding to go forward. She also promises to make her payments on time. She has applied for a loan of  2,000 nuevos soles to buy materials to build a small house on her land so that she can tend her crops in the days before harvesting.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a small house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 45-year-old married man with nine children living in Kasese, Uganda. For six years he has been milling cassava flour and selling it to various markets. John uses the proceeds to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming.  Unpredictable seasonal weather changes and price fluctuations affect his business.


John, who used his previous loan to buy cassava flour to sell, has requested a new loan for the same purpose. His goal is to own a food store that can sustainably supply the whole region.

loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is a 40-year-old, married man, with four children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a driver who earns a salary, but also carries out other businesses, such as farming and animal-rearing in order to raise money to support his growing family. Low salary payment and price fluctuations are his major challenges, while his desire is to buy more land for farming and also to buy a taxi.

John Bosco intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Yosamu

texts.en:
Yosamu lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of his family.  

He does farming and operates a motorcycle business in order to earn a living. Lack of sufficient manpower, unpredictable weather changes, and high cost of transportation of his products are his major challenges, while his dream is to become a model farmer in the area.

Yosamu intends to use the loan to pay workers who are weeding his garden and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his garden and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 37 años, esta casada con Máximo quien es padre de sus 3 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa construida a base de adobe. Se dedica a las actividades agrícolas desde hace 7 años con el apoyo de su esposo. Le agrada su trabajo puesto que es una actividad que desempeñó junto a sus padres y abuelos a quienes recuerda con mucho cariño y agradece por lo aprendido. Los productos que finalmente logra obtener son llevados hasta la ciudad y vendido a los compradores cuyo precio actual cubre los gastos efectuados en la producción. Desea actualmente realizar la renovación de varios árboles de cacao que se encuenntran desfasados y por ello debe adquirir plantas de almácigo listos para ser sembrados en reemplazo para aprovechar el área total de su parcela. Este es el cuarto préstamo que solicita a su entidad financiera y considera que es una buena oportunidad para desempeñar sus labores con facilidad usando el dinero en sus terrenos. En está oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas tipo almácigo y reemplazar los árboles de cacao desfasados en sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old and married to Maximo who is the father of their three children. They live together in their home built from adobe. She has been farming for seven years with the help of her husband. She likes her work, as it is an activity she carried out with her parents and grandparents, whom she remembers very fondly. She is grateful for what she has learned. 

The crops she manages to obtain in the end are taken to the city and sold to the buyers whose current price covers the costs incurred in production. 

Now she wishes to renew several cacao trees that are over-mature, so she must acquire seedlings ready to be planted as replacements. This is so that she can make best use of the total area of her plot of land. 

This is the fourth loan she is requesting from the financial institution, and she considers it a good opportunity to facilitate her work by using the money on her land. On this occasion she wishes to have 2000 new soles to buy seedlings and replace over-mature cacao trees on her farmland.

loans.use: To buy cacao seedlings.

loans.name: Hrachuhi

texts.en:
Hrachuhi is from the village Lor, in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and two small sons (six and seven years old). 

Hrachuhi is employed in the private sector. However, her salary is very low and the family needs alternative sources of income to meet their daily costs. This is why Hrachuhi and her husband are engaged in breeding livestock of cows and hens, beekeeping, and cultivation of beeches, alfalfa, potatoes, apples, pears, and nuts. The family has already established a successful agribusiness. 

To continue developing their agribusiness, the family needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase agricultural machinery for mowing the grass and to buy diesel fuel for the machinery. Hrachuhi and her family will be grateful to the lenders for supporting them in developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery for mowing the grass and to buy diesel fuel for the machinery.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.en:
Maria Angelica is 35 years old, married with 2 children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria Angelica has a food production business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Maria Angelica has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 54 years old, married with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Shirley has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Shirley has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Trygen

texts.en:
Trygen is 34 years old and married, with four children. Three of her children are in school. Trygen works very hard to provide for them.

Trygen runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

Trygen has been in this business for two years, and she sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, diapers, spices, and other groceries. 

In the future, Trygen would like to save enough money to build an internet cafe business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan is from Armash village of Ararat region. He has been involved in a retail business for many years. In particular, Vardan runs a general store where he sells different products to locals. Due to Vardan's nice attitude toward his customers, he has gained many local customers who value the quality of service that Vardan provides. He lives together with his wife, three grown up sons and his parents. As the main breadwinner of the family, Vardan works hard to sustain their living. Now he needs financial support to purchase supplies for his store to sell to his customers. Vardan is asking for a loan of USD 3000 and hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for supplies to sell in the store

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik is an experienced agronomist from the village of Basen in the Shirak region.  Her family consists of her husband, her daughter, and her two sons. Shushanik’s older son is in the military service now; her daughter and younger son are school-age children. 

To meet the family’s daily needs, Shushanik breeds livestock:  cows, sheep, and hens. She is also involved in beekeeping. Her family members assist her a lot in running the farm. Shushanik’s husband helps her to sell the agricultural products at the local market. 

As the needs of the family are growing day by day, they now need to enlarge their livestock a little bit. A loan of US$ 2,500 will be a huge support to this hard-working family and will help them purchase eight calves. 

Shushanik and her family will be grateful to the lenders for their good will in helping them to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase eight calves to add to her livestock

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: Don Alberto es originario de la ciudad Estelí, casado padre de 3 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la elaboración de muebles de madera desde hace mucho tiempo. Tiene a cargo a sus tres hijos, ya que su esposa se encuentra trabajando fuera del país. Está agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que con el credito anterior logro comprar materiales que necesitaba para elaborar muebles, asi mismo aumento sus ventas y obtubo mayores ingreso. Estima que al adquirir el crédito podrá realizar mayor producción para sus clientes, con el fin de satisfacer las   necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima como: lija, pegamento, sener, plycem entre otros. Su plan futuro es tener su propio local, donde exhibir sus muebles y ser reconocido por su buen trabajo. Se considera una persona con muchas expectativas, que con esfuerzo y dedicación podrá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in Estelí, is married, and has three children. He is a merchant, who has been making wood furniture for a long time. He takes care of his three children while his wife is working outside the country. He thanks Kiva and MiCredito for the previous loan, with which he was able to buy needed materials to make furniture. This increased his sales and income. He expects this loan to allow him to increase production and satisfy his customers' needs. 

Alberto has applied for a loan to buy supplies like sandpaper, glue, plywood, and more. He plans to have his own space some day, where he can display his furniture and receive recognition for his craftsmanship. He has great expectations to grow his business through hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sandpaper, glue, plywood, and more.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is a private entrepreneur, from Yerevan. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children. 

Susanna is the only breadwinner in the family. She runs a small store where she sells meat products. The income she gets form her small business is hardly covering the family’s basic costs. This is why she wants to expand the assortment of meat products she sells in the store. 

To reach her goal and to cover the family’s everyday needs more effectively, Susanna needs a loan of USD 3,000 to buy more meat products to sell. Susanna and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for their willingness to support this hard-working woman in enlarging her small business and further developing it.

loans.use: to pay for more meat products to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Las Flores Del Molino Group

texts.es: Dúo Las Flores del molino. este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria de 62 años de edad, ella se ha dedica a la crianza de animales(pollos) desde hace 5 años, es un negocio que le ha servido para sacar adelante a su familia, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de pollos para la crianza y compra de alimentos para los mismos, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Maria, 62, belongs to the communal bank "Dúo las flores del molino." She has been raising chickens for five years, a business that has helped support her family. She has applied for a loan to buy chickens to raise and feed for them, and she is hoping that the lenders will help her with this funding.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married, with two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

For eight years, Cecilia has owned and operated a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She earns PHP 2,000 each month. 

Cecilia joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2009. She successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to improve her business. 

Now, Cecilia is requesting a new loan of PHP 6,500 to purchase raw ingredients for making snacks to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

loans.name: 03.03.12 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phức works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Phức is 61 years old and she is married, with five children. She is the group leader of the 03.03.12 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of five members. Phức lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Phức joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Phức has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phức hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy poulty to raise and sell.

loans.name: Andy Kim

texts.en:
Andy Kim, 29, is a single entrepreneur in Pangabuan, Tangub City. He earns income from his transport service business. It's been running for three years, and he earns PHP 4,000 a month. He has also worked as an account officer for a private company. 

He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to obtain accessories and tires. Recently, he has borrowed a new loan of PHP 10,000 to renew his licenses. He plans to acquire another motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to renew his licenses for motorcycle transport

loans.name: Tuvsanaa

texts.en:
Mr.Tuvsanaa is 47 years old and lives in a small house with his wife and three children, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife, Bulgantamir, works at a local company. His older daughter is a university student and his younger two children attend local schools. 

Tuvsanaa has been working at a local wooden furniture-making company since 1996. He has built close relationships with his suppliers and fellow workers and now he is planning to start his own furniture-manufacturing business, at home, with his two fellow workers.

Tuvsanaa is now requesting loan of MNT 5,000,000 to purchase inventory and other necessary tools to start his furniture-manufacturing business. 

He is a passionate, talented, and hard-working man who says, "I am the happiest person on earth when I am in my woodshop, crafting furniture for my clients."

loans.use: to purchase inventory and other necessary tools to start his furniture-manufacturing business.

loans.name: Delgertsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Delgertsogt, who is 27 years old, lives with his wife, two children, and father-in-law in an old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been working as an assistant in a building company for two years. His wife is a cook by profession but currently is staying at home looking after their children. His father-in-law is a sentry at a university and gets a retirement pension. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years, and it needs some serious repair as winter approaches. So Delgertsogt is requesting a loan of MNT 4,300,000 to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, cements, planks, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, he can finally repair and insulate his house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place for his family. 

Also the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, and reduced coal usage has positive impact on environment as fewer pollutants will be released into atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her undergraduate and graduate diploma fees.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 63 years old and married, with eight children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 69 years old and married.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soap, sugar and other groceries.

Alicia has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Alicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Myagmarjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Myagmarjargal, 39, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She is a journalist and works on newspapers at a private firm. Her husband creates brochures and bulletins on orders from clients. Their children are all young and the youngest one goes to kindergarten. 

Since winter is coming closer, Myagmarjargal wants to repair and insulate her old house by purchasing building and insulation materials as well as a low-pressure heater. For this cause, she is requesting a loan of MNT 3,000,000. 

After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to purchase a low-pressure heater and insulation materials.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 36 años, esta casada con Frank y tiene tres hijos con quiens vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Olga se dedica a la agricultura y al cumplir 21 años se casó y al tener su primer hijo recibió como herencia un terreno para la construcción de su vivienda por parte de sus progenitores que le ayudaron de esta manera a facilitar la compra de un terreno en las afueras de su ciudad y que le sirve como principal fuente de ingreso al iniciar su vida conyugal. Actualmente cuenta con  una hectárea y media de su terreno agrícola con árboles de cacao orgánico que mantiene en buen estado. Lo que más le agrada es que el precio por los productos que cultiva va en aumento y eso le ayuda a recuperar el dinero que invierte en cada campaña productiva. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Olga is 36 years old. She is married to Frank and has three children with whom she lives in her adobe home. Olga makes a living through agriculture. When she turned 21 years old, she got married, and when she had her first child, she inherited some land to construct her home from her parents. They helped her by making the purchase of some land in the outskirts of the city easier. It served her as a main source of income when she began her married life.

Currently, she has a hectare and a half of agricultural land with organic cacao trees that she maintains in a good state. What she is thankful for the most is that the price for the products she cultivates is growing, which helps her to recuperate the money that she invests in the productive season. 

This is her third loan with Kiva, and she is thankful for the financial support that she is receiving to continue forward. Furthermore, she promises to make her payments punctually. In this opportunity, she wishes to count on 2,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase organic compost.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
Although the loan has entered the eighth cycle, the Satya Laksana group still requires financial support and assistance from MUK. They still need to be trained and assisted in raising pigs until they can become independent of capital.

Ni Ketut went in on a new loan. Now she has a stall in addition to raising pigs.  She used the loan to buy feed and to repair cages. She hopes the sow will give birth to piglets soon. Every morning she cleans the cages and feeds the pigs, and then she opens the small kiosk that’s in front of her house. 

She’s very happy because in old age, she has a business that can ensure the continuity of her life.

loans.use: To buy feed and to repair cages

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from selling frozen foods. 

Leah is borrowing PHP 60,000 through NWTF in order to buy motorcycle spare parts for her tricycle for her transport business.

Leah has sustained her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Jessenia Argentina

texts.es: Jessenia es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 32 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos, es de oficio comerciante y se dedica  al negocio de pulpería. Esta  agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito por el apoyo que le han brindado, ya que al recibir el primer financiamiento pudo invertir en  productos como granos básicos y embutidos lo cual ha sido de gran importancia para aumentar su clientela e ingresos.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, jabón, pastillas, cosméticos, sandalias, ropa entre otros con el fin de abastecer a sus clientes.  Considera que los préstamos son de mucha ayuda para los comerciantes, ya que tienen  oportunidad de invertir en lo que necesitan para el incremento de su negocio. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y mantener un nivel de vida estable.
texts.en: Jessenia is originally from Managua.  She is 32 years old and a merchant with a general store.  She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito for the support they have provided.  Her fist loan allowed her to invest in products such as basic grains and sausages which have been of great importance in increasing her number of customers and income.  She is asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, juices, soft drinks, soap, pills, cosmetics, sandals, clothing, and other things to stock her store.  She considers these loans to be of great help for merchants because they have the opportunity to buy what they need to grow their businesses.  Her plans for the future are to improve her home’s infrastructure and maintain a stable life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic salt to sell to capital city residents.

loans.name: Pampallacta De Pisac Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PAMPALLACTA DE PISAC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Pisac, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nazaria ella es casada y tiene 31 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia siembra maíz, la socia cría las gallinas y cuyes los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de queso, la socia vende los quesos a diferentes personas, por medio de estos pequeño negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las gallinas y cuyes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gallinas y cuyes.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ovejas, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “PAMPALLACTA DE PISAC” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Pisac, which is part of Calca province and the department of Cusco.

The member Nazaria is married, 31 and has 4 children. She works in her business selling and raising animals and she also makes a living in the agriculture business. She plants corn, raises hens and guinea pigs and makes them grow and fatten and then later sells them in different markets. She also makes a living selling cheese. She sells cheeses to different people. Through these small businesses she brings up her children. Her dream is to have a place of business where she can sell the hens and guinea pigs. She is applying for this loan to buy hens and guinea pigs.

The other members make their living selling sheep, chicha [a traditional corn-based beverage], grocery stores and agriculture businesses.

Nazaria thanks those who are part of this dream through this means and she commits to fulfill the payment of her installments in the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Joesel

texts.en:
Joesel is married with an only child and is from the village of Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.  To make a living, Joesel owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He manages his own farm in his free time and on weekends, for he works in a private company as a security guard.

In 2007, Joesel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve his living situation. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to expand his farm. Recently, he requested a new loan amount of 15,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) to purchase fertilizer. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his house so his family can have a better situation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Unurtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Unurtsetseg, 31 years old, lives with her younger sister and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her sister have been running a grocery store since 2010. Their mother had a stroke and so she needs constant care. Her sister is planning to study in Japan and recently received her university offer. Due to a lack of cash, her sister can't afford to pay the tuition fee. So the client is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to contribute to her sister's education costs. After her sister graduates and comes back to Mongolia, their life will certainly improve.

loans.use: to pay for educational costs

loans.name: Tsevegjav

texts.en: Tsevegjav is 39 years old lives with his wife and two sons in a traditional nomadic yurt called a Ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife Myagmarjav helps her husband in their family business of selling organic flour in the local market. His older son Nyamdalai is 16 and a student at the local school, and his younger son Nyambayar is 3 and goes to local kindergarten. Tsevegjav needs to increase his sales to make additional profits to save for his older son's university expense which will soon to be needed. He is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic flour to sell to local customers. Tsevegjav and his family are kind, caring and hardworking people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic flour to sell to local customers
